{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"How to turn off the automatic emergency call feature on your iPhone so that you don't accidentally dial 911","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-turn-off-emergency-call-on-iphone","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5129f17ed0ee001e25d4f5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"woman walking in city with smart cellphone headphones\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It&#39;s easy to disable your iPhone&#39;s automatic emergency call feature.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Maskot/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can turn off the automatic emergency call feature in your iPhone's settings menu so that you don't accidentally trigger a call to 911.&#160;</li>\n<li>The emergency call feature can be triggered by holding down the Power button with one of the Volume buttons and swiping to call 911.&#160;</li>\n<li>It can also be triggered by pressing the Power button rapidly five times, or by holding down the Power and Volume buttons long enough to automatically call without the need to swipe.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\"><strong>Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/iphone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">iPhones</a> have several built-in methods for dialing 911 emergency services just by touching the external buttons on your phone.&#160;</p><p>This feature is designed to allow you to quickly call for help without having to unlock your phone and dial as you would with a normal call.&#160;</p><h2><strong>How your iPhone will automatically call 911</strong></h2><ul><li>If you press either of the Volume buttons with the Power button on your phone, it'll display the Emergency page, which includes the SOS slider. Swiping the slider to the right will dial 911.&#160;</li><li>If you simply continue to hold the Volume and Power buttons, your iPhone will start a short countdown and dial 911 automatically.&#160;</li><li>If you rapidly press the Power button five times in a row, your iPhone will start a short countdown and dial 911 automatically.</li></ul><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5124f0e6ff30001d4e6e74?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_turn_off_emergency_call_on_iPhone 1\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2417\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can open the Emergency page by holding the Power button along with either of the Volume buttons.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>While useful in emergencies, you might worry about triggering either or both of these methods accidentally. If so, you can disable them.&#160;</p><h2><strong>How to turn off the emergency call feature on an iPhone</strong></h2><p><strong>1.</strong> Start the Settings app.</p><p><strong>2.</strong> Tap \"Emergency SOS.\"</p><p><strong>3.</strong> If you want to disable your phone's ability to automatically call 911 when you press the Power button five times, turn off \"Call with Side Button\" by swiping the button to the left.&#160;</p><p><strong>4.</strong> If you want to disable your phone's ability to automatically call 911 when you hold the Volume and Power buttons, turn off \"Auto Call\" by swiping the button to the left.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5125b7e6ff30001d4e6e76?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_turn_off_emergency_call_on_iPhone 2\" height=\"1817\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can customize how emergency calls are triggered in Settings.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Even if you turn off both of those features, you can still call emergency services from your phone's external buttons, but you need to swipe the SOS slider on the Emergency page to do so.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5d8e19fb2e22af18f40d281d\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5d8e19fb2e22af18f40d281d&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-turn-on-emergency-alerts-on-iphone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How to turn on emergency alerts on your iPhone to stay aware of local emergencies and safety warnings<br></a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-use-iphone-as-digital-car-keys\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How to use your iPhone as digital car keys if you have a compatible vehicle</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/iphone-keyboard-shortcuts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How to use keyboard shortcuts on your iPhone or create your own, to type faster and more accurately</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/does-your-iphone-charge-faster-on-low-power-mode\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Does your iPhone charge faster on Low Power Mode? 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"As oil gains stall, the nation's largest oil company looks to job cuts","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/latest-news-on-oil-energy-industry-layoffs-job-cuts-exxon-2020-9","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4fcb7f7ed0ee001e25d07e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Exxon gas station\" height=\"2333\" width=\"3500\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption> \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Kena Betancur/VIEWpress/Corbis via Getty Images</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<p>Welcome to Insider Energy, a weekly energy newsletter brought to you by Business Insider.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Here's what you need to know:</p>\n<ul>\n <li>Want to get Insider Energy in your inbox every Friday? <a href=\"http://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/power-line\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\">Sign up here</a>.&nbsp;</li>\n <li>Most of our content is available to BI subscribers. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/subscription/prime-discount?r=birefer-bjoneshttps://www.businessinsider.com/subscription/prime-discount?r=birefer-bjones\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\">Click here for 20% off</a>.&nbsp;</li>\n <li>Got feedback or tips? Email me <a href=\"mailto:bjones@businessinsider.com\">here</a> or shoot me a text at 646-768-1657.&nbsp;</li>\n</ul>\n<p>I'm thrilled about two things: We're on the cusp of a holiday weekend, and today we get to talk about gay things.&nbsp;I'm not talking about joy. Obviously.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Let's get to it.&nbsp;</p>\n<hr>\n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f50f3ce7ed0ee001e25d384?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BIg oil LGBTQ 4x3\" height=\"1251\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Shayanne Gal/Business Insider</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure>\n <h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lgbtq-oil-workers-face-tough-reality-abroad-antigay-laws-2020-8\"><strong>Where oil and gay rights don't mix</strong></a></h2>\n <p>LGBTQ icon RuPaul <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2020/mar/21/rupaul-fracking-wyoming-ranch-land-oil\">may have a fracking empire</a>, but any reference to his popular TV show Drag Race, a drag queen competition, is likely to land with a big thud on an oil rig.</p>\n <p>To be clear, the oil industry's biggest Western companies have made huge strides in their support for LGBTQ workers in the last decade.</p>\n <ul>\n  <li>Four of the largest companies including Chevron and Shell, for example, all <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lgbtq-oil-workers-face-tough-reality-abroad-antigay-laws-2020-8\">aced Human Rights Campaign's national corporate equality index this year</a>, indicating that they support their gay workers.&nbsp;</li>\n </ul>\n <p>But the story of inclusion becomes a lot more complicated in the non-Western world, where these companies have enormous operations and thousands of employees.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul>\n  <li>Many hotspots of the oil industry, like Nigeria and Saudi Arabia, outlaw same-sex relations and/or criminalize forms of gender expression.</li>\n  <li>Some places even maintain the death penalty for same-sex behavior.</li>\n </ul>\n <p><strong>Analysis: </strong>We compared the global operations of seven of the world's largest oil companies to regions with anti-LGBTQ laws.</p>\n <ul>\n  <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lgbtq-oil-workers-face-tough-reality-abroad-antigay-laws-2020-8\">You can see the results of that analysis here in beautiful graphics made by BI's Shayanne Gal</a>.&nbsp;</li>\n  <li>We found that multinational oil companies operate in more than 40 countries that outlaw same-sex relations.&nbsp;&nbsp;</li>\n </ul>\n <p><strong>So what? </strong>In these regions, global companies, based in the West, face a tension between upholding their own nondiscrimination policies and abiding by local laws and conforming to the national culture.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul>\n  <li>LGBTQ workers get caught in the middle of this tension, and experts say nondiscrimination policies aren't enough to protect them.&nbsp;</li>\n  <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lgbtq-oil-workers-face-tough-reality-abroad-antigay-laws-2020-8\">You can read more in our full story</a>.&nbsp;</li>\n </ul>\n <p><strong>How you can help: </strong>Are you or an acquaintance a member of the LGBTQ community and working in the oil industry? If you're comfortable reaching out, <a href=\"mailto:bjones@businessinsider.com\">we'd love to hear about your experience</a>.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\n <hr>\n  <figure> \n   <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5258f3e6ff30001d4e71d3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Exxon Mobil's Fife Ethylene Plant in Cowdenbeath, Scotland\" height=\"1995\" width=\"2661\" charset=\"\"> \n    <figcaption>\n     Exxon Mobil's Fife Ethylene Plant in Cowdenbeath, Scotland \n     <p class=\"copyright\">Ken Jack/Getty Images</p> \n    </figcaption> </img>\n  </figure>\n  <h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/exxon-job-cuts-layoffs-oil-price-downturn-everything-we-know\"><strong>Exxon has long avoided talk of job cuts. That's starting to change.</strong></a><strong>&nbsp;</strong></h2>\n  <p>Exxon's pitch to prospective workers is that it's a stable giant within an industry prone to swings. Part of that pitch is that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/exxon-managers-dub-some-employees-poor-performers-cut-staff-2020-7\">it doesn't do layoffs</a>.&nbsp;</p>\n  <ul>\n   <li>\"Our size and the integrated nature of our operations provide stability throughout the economic cycle,\" notes accompanying an Exxon campus-recruiting presentation seen by Business Insider <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/exxon-managers-dub-some-employees-poor-performers-cut-staff-2020-7\">said</a>.</li>\n   <li>\"This point should help ease the concerns of students who may be worried about joining an oil-and-gas company due to news reports about layoffs in the industry over the last few years,\" <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/exxon-managers-dub-some-employees-poor-performers-cut-staff-2020-7\">they continued</a>.&nbsp;</li>\n  </ul>\n  <p>Companies use layoffs to cut costs during financial strife. Right now is a great example, considering the oil market collapsed earlier this year — and it's still struggling to gain ground.&nbsp;</p>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Most major companies <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-top-oil-companies-are-responding-to-the-price-shock-2020-3\">have responded by cutting staff</a> (<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-top-oil-companies-are-responding-to-the-price-shock-2020-3\">we're tracking layoffs here</a>).&nbsp;</li>\n   <li>Oil giants BP and Schlumberger, for example, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-top-oil-companies-are-responding-to-the-price-shock-2020-3\">have announced they're cutting more than 30,000 workers combined</a>.&nbsp;</li>\n  </ul>\n  <p><strong>Exxon's approach: </strong>The company initially took an alternative approach to shrink its workforce, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/exxon-managers-dub-some-employees-poor-performers-cut-staff-2020-7\">using performance reviews to cut staff</a>.</p>\n  <ul>\n   <li>But now the oil giant is changing its tune. Exxon is weighing cuts in its offices around the world, Business Insider <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/leaked-memo-exxon-layoffs-weighing-job-cuts-in-upstream-division-2020-9\">first reported</a>.&nbsp;</li>\n   <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/exxon-job-cuts-layoffs-oil-price-downturn-everything-we-know\">Here's everything we know about job cuts at Exxon.</a></li>\n   <li>If you have a tip about Exxon, please reach out to me <a href=\"mailto:bjones@businessinsider.com\">here</a> or on <a href=\"https://signal.org/en/\">Signal</a> at +1-646-768-1657.&nbsp;</li>\n  </ul>\n  <p><strong>A brief note for investors: </strong>Goldman Sachs came out with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/goldman-sachs-oil-stocks-investors-should-buy-avoid-exxon-2020-8\">a list of its 10 top energy stock picks</a> this week for investors looking beyond Exxon. <strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/goldman-sachs-oil-stocks-investors-should-buy-avoid-exxon-2020-8\">You can see those all here</a>.&nbsp;</strong></p>\n  <hr>\n   <figure> \n    <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f525a177ed0ee001e25d870?format=jpeg\" alt=\"New cars drive during a ceremony marking start of the production of a new electric Volkswagen model ID.3 in Zwickau\" height=\"3044\" width=\"4059\" charset=\"\"> \n     <figcaption> \n      <p class=\"copyright\">Matthias Rietschel/Reuters</p> \n     </figcaption> </img>\n   </figure>\n   <h2><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/quantumscape-spac-ipo-market-ev-bill-gates-backed-battery-company-2020-9-1029560551\"><strong>A breakthrough battery startup backed by Bill Gates is going public</strong></a></h2>\n   <p>In the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/billion-dollar-race-to-develop-a-breakthrough-lithium-ion-battery-2020-2\">billion-dollar race</a> between startups and investors to develop a better battery for electric cars, one company just got a lot closer to the finish line, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/quantumscape-spac-ipo-market-ev-bill-gates-backed-battery-company-2020-9-1029560551#\">BI's Ben Winck reports</a>.</p>\n   <p>Backed by Volkswagen and Breakthrough Energy Ventures, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/list-of-clean-energy-startups-bill-gates-is-backing-2020-4\">a fund spearheaded by Bill Gates</a>, the secretive startup QuantumScape revealed three big updates this week, Medium's <a href=\"https://marker.medium.com/vw-one-ups-tesla-with-a-revolutionary-battery-breakthrough-be51849ea092\">Marker</a> reported.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\n   <ul>\n    <li><strong>Breakthrough: </strong>The firm, which makes solid-state batteries, said it's solved the problem of working with pure lithium, a finicky material prone to fires. This is a big deal, <a href=\"https://marker.medium.com/vw-one-ups-tesla-with-a-revolutionary-battery-breakthrough-be51849ea092\">Marker explains</a>.&nbsp;</li>\n    <li><strong>Timeline: </strong>VW electric cars could run on QuantumScape's pure metallic lithium batteries as soon as 2025.&nbsp;</li>\n    <li><strong>IPO: </strong>The startup said it was going public using a special purpose acquisition company, or SPAC, with a value of <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/quantumscape-spac-ipo-market-ev-bill-gates-backed-battery-company-2020-9-1029560551#\">$3.3 billion</a>. <strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong></li>\n   </ul>\n   <p><strong>WTF is a SPAC? </strong>Also known as blank check firms, SPACs are companies that raise money from investors with the sole purpose of acquiring other businesses, BI's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/spac-blank-check-companies-explained-2020-5\">Melia Russell reports</a>.&nbsp;</p>\n   <ul>\n    <li>\"As the two companies merge, the publicly traded SPAC effectively takes the private business public, without the pomp and cork-popping of a traditional IPO,\" she writes.&nbsp;</li>\n    <li>In the case of QuantumScape, it will be merging with Kensington Capital Acquisition Corp., and appear on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker QE.&nbsp;</li>\n    <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/spac-blank-check-companies-explained-2020-5\">You can read Melia's full explainer on SPACs, and why they've become so popular amid the pandemic, here</a>.&nbsp;</li>\n   </ul>\n   <hr>\n    <figure> \n     <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f525a52e6ff30001d4e71d9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Wind turbines\" height=\"2400\" width=\"3199\" charset=\"\"> \n      <figcaption>\n       Wall Street analysts say the renewable energy industry may be more insulated from a recession than other industries. \n       <p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p> \n      </figcaption> </img>\n    </figure>\n    <h2><strong>4 big stories we didn't cover</strong></h2>\n    <ol>\n     <li>Driving out of town this weekend? You'll see the lowest Labor Day gas prices since 2004,&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.eia.gov/todayinenergy/detail.php?id=45036&amp;src=emailmail\">according to</a> the US Energy Information Administration.&nbsp;</li>\n     <li>Schlumberger, the largest oilfield services company in the world, is <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-schlumberger-divestiture-liberty-oilf/schlumberger-sells-fracking-unit-as-oil-price-cripples-demand-idUSKBN25S4UD\">selling its North American fracking business</a> to rival Liberty Oilfield Services as oil prices fail to gain ground.&nbsp;</li>\n     <li>Two-thirds of all new energy added globally last year came from solar and wind energy, while fossil fuels accounted for just a quarter, according to <a href=\"https://about.bnef.com/blog/solar-and-wind-reach-67-of-new-power-capacity-added-globally-in-2019-while-fossil-fuels-slide-to-25/?utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosgenerate&amp;stream=topp;stream=top\">new data</a> from the research firm BloombergNEF.</li>\n     <li>Consumer goods giant Unilever, which sells products ranging from Lipton tea to Dove soap, <a href=\"https://www.unilever.com/news/press-releases/2020/unilever-to-invest-1-billion-to-eliminate-fossil-fuels-in-cleaning-products-by-2030.html\">said</a> it would remove fossil fuels from its cleaning products. Many cleaning products are made using oil-derived ingredients, which is kind of ironic, because <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127999735#:~:text=Live%20Sessions-,Why%20Dawn%20Is%20The%20Bird%20Cleanser%20Of%20Choice%20For%20Oil,key%20ingredient%20in%20the%20detergent\">soap is often used to clean up oil</a>.</li>\n    </ol>\n    <p>That's it! Have a great holiday weekend, and feel free to drop me any feedback <a href=\"mailto:bjones@businessinsider.com\">here</a>.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\n    <p>- Benji&nbsp;</p>\n    <div +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f5258f3e6ff30001d4e71d3?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"3f90387455a04f8cd436554d25146d5c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn56@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-37-14-063_980d94bbeaac0237.webp","destWidth":2661,"destHeight":1995,"sourceBytes":228446,"destBytes":228446,"author":"bjones@businessinsider.com Jones)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4fcb7f7ed0ee001e25d07e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn24@2020_4/2020/09/04/16-38-01-542_a028a33cd7e181e0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f50f3ce7ed0ee001e25d384?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn35@2020_3/2020/09/04/16-37-57-856_c06e7eb64aa4e3fc.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f5258f3e6ff30001d4e71d3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn56@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-37-14-063_980d94bbeaac0237.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f525a177ed0ee001e25d870?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn23@2020_4/2020/09/04/16-37-57-781_a29a36ad3d151db5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f525a52e6ff30001d4e71d9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn20@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-38-04-138_6c6d48b50069fe6a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-03-978_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=-_tQ77VZxx8:WBelOey3jcQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn64@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-37-58-274_905925d423256674.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=-_tQ77VZxx8:WBelOey3jcQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn13@2020_3/2020/09/04/16-38-06-450_df10c0fb906145d7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-085_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=-_tQ77VZxx8:WBelOey3jcQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn75@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-38-02-093_14247be64f473ade.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/-_tQ77VZxx8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/04/16-38-04-833_137300e91334954f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599237433655},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"10 products we use in everyday life that wouldn’t exist without NASA","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/consumer-products-nasa-helped-invent","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d375b9f454a390da74cb152?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Products that wouldn&#39;t exist without NASA 4x3\" height=\"3750\" width=\"5000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alyssa Powell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>NASA was the force behind many product development innovations that you might take for granted.&#160;</li><li>The research used to develop and improve space suits, time-keeping systems, temperature measurements, and other space-related needs is often later adapted for consumer use.&#160;&#160;</li><li>Products like <a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.nike.com/w/air-max-a6d8h\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">running sneakers</a>, <a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.sunglasshut.com/us/ray-ban/rb2132-805289048534?sid=hpz-feature-805289048534-rb2132_new_wayfarer_classic\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">scratch-resistant glasses,</a> and <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/CHI-Original-Straightening-Ceramic-Hairstyling/dp/B0009V1YR8/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&linkCode=sl1&tag=biip_072319_nasa-inspired-products-20&linkId=7dcbb715b05aa454acd4f00365eac09b&language=en_USp;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">hairstyling irons</a> all owe their success to the work of NASA scientists and researchers.&#160;</li></ul><p>If you <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-apollo-11-50th-anniversary-products-merch-gifts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">weren't obsessed enough already</a> with the work that NASA does to advance our knowledge of space, here's another reason: its research has a large number of applications beyond space suits and shuttles.&#160;</p><p>Though the science it engages with can seem nebulously complicated, it's really all around us in the products we use every day.&#160;Technology originally developed to support the nation's astronauts is often later adapted for consumer use. If you take a closer look around your house and closet on Earth, it doesn't take long to come across something that was also employed by astronauts floating in space hundreds of thousands of miles away.</p><p>Knowing the historical origins of these everyday products certainly helps us appreciate innovations that we previously took for granted.&#160;</p><h2>You have NASA research to thank for these 10 popular products:&#160;</h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tNike sneakers\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d374dab100a244ef93d2945?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nasa products 7\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Nike</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.nike.com/w/air-max-a6d8h\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop Air Max sneakers at Nike, from $44</a></h3><p>You might not know it, but if you own a pair of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/adidas-ultra-boost-vs-nike-air-vapormax-sneaker-comparison-2018-2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nike Air sneakers</a>, you've actually been walking in the shoes of astronauts. The ubiquitous sneaker's shock-absorbing material, which gives you the light, cushion-y support for better runs, <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/missions/science/f_apollo_11_spinoff.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">originates from a \"blow rubber molding\" process</a> used to make astronaut helmets.&#160;</p>\n\tMemory foam mattresses\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d3750c348c50a05e85272de?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nasa products 1\" height=\"750\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Leesa</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://Leesa-Sleep.lvuv.net/c/196318/236769/4014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.leesa.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Shop memory foam mattresses at Leesa, from $599</a></h3><p>NASA-funded contractor Charles Yost <a href=\"https://spinoff.nasa.gov/database/spinoffDetail.php?this=/spinoff//arc/ARC-SO-76\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">developed memory foam</a> in the late 1960s to improve airline seating for crash protection and comfort. Both soft and able to absorb high-energy impact, it was the perfect material to outfit NASA planes and is today widely applied to many home and comfort-related products, like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/leesa-foam-mattress-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">mattresses</a>,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/layla-memory-foam-pillow-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">pillows</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-travel-pillow#the-best-memory-foam-travel-pillow-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">travel pillows</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tBowflex home gym systems\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d37599f100a244ce31b76da?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nasa products 8\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/stores/page/30923DE7-E4FF-49C5-B890-F790412B8BB6/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ingress=2&#38;visitId=d0a45https://amzn.to/2y5GdXC600-4c20-4ec9-9d6d-f953e5710854&#38;ref_=bl_dp_s_web_2586271011&#38;linkCode=sl2&#38;tag=biip_072319_nasa-inspired-products-20&#38;linkId=f76a43b7907c2a701a425136c0b1396e&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop Bowflex home gym systems at Amazon, from $249</a></h3><p>Prolonged weightlessness weakens muscles and bones, and with the construction of the International Space Station, which was expected to house long-term crews, <a href=\"https://spinoff.nasa.gov/Spinoff2019/cg_1.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">NASA needed an exercise system</a> that could keep astronaut bodies strong while in space for long periods of time. Instead of using weights, which are ineffective in space, BowFlex systems use springs to provide resistance. They're easier on the joints, and they pack a versatile number of exercises into <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/space-saving-at-home-workout-gear-tools-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">one compact machine</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tEar thermometers\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d375a468813a209ea031572?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nasa products 9\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Braun-Thermometer-ThermoScan-Toddlers-Accurate/dp/B00MUK6M82/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=sl1&#38;tag=biip_072319_nasa-inspired-products-20&#38;linkId=77a0d86397111d066746afae67facc19&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop the Braun Digital Ear Thermometer at Amazon, $64.99</a></h3><p>Just like astronomers measure the temperature of stars and planets with infrared technology, you can quickly figure out your body temperature <a href=\"https://spinoff.nasa.gov/database/spinoffDetail.php?this=/spinoff//jpl/JPL-SO-128\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">with aural thermometers</a>, which measure the amount of infrared energy emitted by the eardrum. Since this method avoids contact with mucous membranes, it eliminates the possibility of cross-infection and is also safer to use with newborns and critically ill patients.&#160;</p>\n\tScratch-resistant glasses\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d3762c9100a246225123942?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nasa products 10\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sunglass Hut</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.sunglasshut.com/us/ray-ban/rb2132-805289048534?sid=hpz-feature-805289048534-rb2132_new_wayfarer_classic\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop the Ray-Ban Wayfarer at Sunglass Hut, $144</a></h3><p>In 1972, the FDA mandated that all sunglasses and prescription lenses had to be shatter-resistant &#8212; a problem for an industry dominated by the use of glass. Manufacturers turned to plastic lenses. On the one hand, they were shatter-resistant, lightweight, and cheaper to produce, but on the other, they were easily scratched.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.spacefoundation.org/what-we-do/space-technology-hall-fame/inducted-technologies/scratch-resistant-lenses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The technology for scratch-resistant lenses</a> originated from a project on a spacecraft water purification system and was also seen in the coating for space helmet visors. Thanks to the Ames Research Center, you can now carry and wear your <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-sunglasses-men\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">stylish sunglasses</a> worry-free.&#160;</p>\n\tRestorative toothpaste\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d376442a13c95066a6e56c9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nasa products 11\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Boka/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=79059&#38;urllink=www.boka.com%2Fproducts%2Fela-mint-toothpaste\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop the Ela Mint Toothpaste at Boka, $12</a></h3><p><a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/station/research/experiments/explorer/Investigation.html?#id=1559\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">A synthetic form of hydroxyapatite</a>, the mineral present in your teeth and bones, was created by NASA to restore bone density in orbiting crew members and is the star ingredient in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/boka-electric-toothbrush-review-2018-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Boka</a>'s mint toothpaste. The non-toxic, biocompatible ingredient can potentially help the millions of people worldwide who suffer from bone density loss.&#160;</p>\n\tAll-weather thermal blankets\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d376f0fa13c95091f666124?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nasa products 13\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3 id=\"title\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01M0XX7SX/ref=as_li_ss_tl?th=1&#38;linkCode=sl1&#38;tag=biip_072319_nasa-inspired-products-20&#38;linkId=9c9a5c23142e07015b34a9c1872bb259&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop the Swiss Safe Mylar Thermal Blanket (4-Pack) at Amazon, $14.99</a></h3><p>Aluminized mylar was <a href=\"https://ntrs.nasa.gov/archive/nasa/casi.ntrs.nasa.gov/20030005425.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">first used to make the Echo satellites more reflective</a> and to insulate cryogenic fluids and spacesuits. Mylar thermal blankets, seen anywhere from marathon finish lines to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-tents-camping\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">camping tents</a> to home emergency kits, are still sometimes referred to as \"space blankets\" as a nod to these origins. They're ultra-light and packable, waterproof and windproof, and very effective at retaining body heat.&#160;</p>\n\tQuartz watches\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d37697da209d3039476e7e5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nasa products 12\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">MVMT</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://mvmt.7eer.net/c/196318/222268/3856?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mvmtwatches.com%2Fcollections%2Fquartz-watches%3Fmvmt_sort_by%3Dmanual\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Shop quartz watches at MVMT, from $73.50</a></h3><p>Accurate timing is of utmost importance on NASA missions, which is why the Johnson Space Center contracted General Time Corp <a href=\"https://ntrs.nasa.gov/search.jsp?R=20030005451\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">to develop a quartz crystal</a>. Because quartz vibrates millions of times per second when electrically stimulated, and watches use vibrating bodies to keep time, NASA was able to establish a stable time base off which all mission times could be derived. For ordinary consumers, they're helping us arrive right on time to our appointments.&#160;</p>\n\tHairstyling irons\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d3774b3100a2468297f5ad6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nasa products 14\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/CHI-Original-Straightening-Ceramic-Hairstyling/dp/B0009V1YR8/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=sl1&#38;tag=biip_072319_nasa-inspired-products-20&#38;linkId=7dcbb715b05aa454acd4f00365eac09b&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop the Chi 1\" Ceramic Hairstyling Iron at Amazon, $58.80</a></h3><p>The secret to shiny, soft, and smooth hair is <a href=\"https://spinoff.nasa.gov/Spinoff2010/cg_5.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">NASA research on nanomaterials</a>, which was first applied to ceramic metallic components that could trigger the release of cancer-fighting drugs from microcapsules.</p><p>When special ceramic nanoparticles are heated, they produce negative or positive ions &#8212; that also turn out to be beneficial for hair and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-curling-iron\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">hair styling</a>. With its link to this research, the brand CHI (Cationic Hydration Interlink) no doubt has an advantage over other hair styling brands.&#160;</p>\n\tCountertop gardens\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ca52110c6cc5068843ed542?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Aerogarden Harvest 4\" height=\"2107\" width=\"2809\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jada Wong/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/stores/node/3016362011/ref=as_li_ss_tl?_encoding=UTF8&#38;field-lbr_brands_browse-bin=AeroGarden&#38;ref_=bl_dp_s_web_3016362011&#38;linkCode=sl2&#38;tag=biip_072319_nasa-inspired-products-20&#38;linkId=d297b7fce02f5d29956e6d272354092c&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop AeroGarden home gardens at Amazon, from $99.99</a></h3><p>During long-term missions, astronauts have to figure out how to grow their own food. Enter <a href=\"https://spinoff.nasa.gov/Spinoff2008/ch_3.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">aeroponic garden systems</a>, which can grow plants suspended in air without soil and reduce water usage by 98%. The clean and efficient food-growing system was brought down to Earth and successfully introduced to the kitchens of small apartments and homes that still wanted to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/aerogarden-harvest-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">enjoy home-grown herbs and vegetables</a>.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"Mohamed El-Erian warns US stocks can 'easily' decline by another 10% after suffering their biggest drop since June","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/mohamed-el-erian-warns-us-stock-market-decline-another-10-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f51e91ee6ff30001d4e7082?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mohamed El-Erian\" height=\"400\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Mohamed El-Erian\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mohamed El-Erian</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Economist Mohamed El-Erian warned on CNBC that the US stock market can \"easily\" fall by another 10% if investor attitudes shift in the coming days.</strong></li><li><strong>His comments came after the Dow, S&#38;P 500, and Nasdaq Composite suffered their biggest declines in months, driven by a massive sell-off in tech stocks on Thursday.</strong></li><li><strong>\"We could have another 10% fall, easily...if people start thinking fundamentals,\" he said, adding that investors would be forced to consider the actual state of the economy and implication of corporate bankruptcies.</strong></li><li><strong>As market fundamentals come into play, \"that is the tug of war that's going to play out, and it's going to show the DNA of investors,\" El-Erian said.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>Markets could be headed for a correction if investors switch their positions in the coming days, economist Mohamed El-Erian said on <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/03/we-could-have-another-10percent-fall-easily-el-erian-says-post-sell-off.html\">CNBC's \"Closing Bell\"</a>&#160;after <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-news-today-indexes-plunge-tech-plunge-jobless-claims-2020-9-1029561733#\">US equities tanked</a> by the most since June 11.</p><p>The economist warned that a change in mindset could be on the horizon, meaning that market participants should be on the watch.</p><p>\"We could have another 10% fall, easily...if people start thinking fundamentals,\" he said.</p><p>The Federal Reserve's multi-billion dollar stimulus packages have emboldened investors to buy any dips that take place in the market, as the central bank's financial support would theoretically help tide over the potential impact of COVID-19 on the corporate sector.</p><p>But that approach could be tested in the near-term as market fundamentals become active, El-Erian said.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-trading-rules-blueprint-from-market-legend-marty-schwartz-2020-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">'I had run $5,000 up to $140,000 in just 2 years': Here are the 7 trading rules stock-market wizard Marty Schwartz leverages to help ensure success</a></em></p><p>\"That is the tug of war that's going to play out, and it's going to show the DNA of investors,\" he said, after the <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500_500\">S&#38;P 500</a> slid 3.5% —&#160; its biggest drop since early June.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones\">Dow</a> closed 808 points lower, or 2.8%, at 28,292.73 on Thursday, its worst single-day loss in three months. A massive sell-off in tech stocks dragged the <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/nasdaq_100\">Nasdaq</a> Composite down 5%, its biggest decline since March.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/aapl-stock?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Apple</a>,&#160;<a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/nvda-stock?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nvidia</a>, and&#160;<a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/zm-stock?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Zoom</a> tumbled after gaining the lead at the market's start-of-the-month rally. The iPhone maker's shares closed down 8% on Thursday, marking its biggest one-day fall since late March.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/fb-stock?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook</a> dropped 6% after announcing the company would <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/facebook-stock-price-announcing-new-political-ad-ban-election-2020-9-1029561405#\">ban political ads</a> in the week&#160;before the November 3 presidential election.&#160;</p><p><strong><em>Read more:</em></strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-invest-in-real-estate-after-coronavirus-tips-ubs-2020-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><em>A UBS real estate-investing chief told us 5 ways investors can profit from the pandemic's transformation of how Americans live and work — including the housing markets poised to boom</em></a></p><p>\"If the mindset changes from technicals to fundamentals then this market has further to go,\" he said, \"but it remains to be seen whether it will change.\"</p><p>As the Nasdaq and S&#38;P 500 posted record highs in August after five straight months of gains, El-Erian said the stock market is not only decoupled from the US economy, but also from the VIX volatility index (also known as the fear index), Treasury, and junk bond markets.</p><p>If investors choose to gauge the stock market based purely on fundamentals, they would find it hard to ignore economic uncertainty and the implication of corporate bankruptcies, he said.</p><p>\"If you are in a liquidity-based paradigm, you will be dominated by relative thinking, and that's where we've been. If you're in a fundamentally-based paradigm,\" El-Erian added, \"the answer is: no, you are not paying for an economy that faces not just moderation in the way of improvement, but a rising level of bankruptcies.\"</p><p><strong><em>Read more: </em></strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-stock-sale-why-to-buy-retail-investors-tasha-keeney-2020-9\" target=\"_blank\" 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"A Ukrainian airline banned a passenger for life after she opened a jet's emergency exit door and walked around on the wing","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/ukraine-international-airlines-passenger-opens-exit-walks-on-wing-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f524722e6ff30001d4e712a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 946078004\" height=\"2000\" width=\"2666\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A passenger flying Ukraine International Airlines opened an emergency exit door and walked out on the wing after reportedly being &#34;too hot.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Maxym Marusenko/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A passenger flying Ukraine International Airlines opened an overwing emergency exit door on Monday to cool down after reportedly being \"too hot,\" <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/passenger-takes-walk-on-airplane-wing/index.html\">CNN</a> reported.</li>\n<li>The Boeing 737-800 had just arrived at the gate in Kyiv from Antalya, Turkey when the female passenger opened the door and ventured out onto the wing.&#160;</li>\n<li>Ukraine International Airlines has since banned her from future flights.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A routine Ukraine International Airlines flight from Antalya, Turkey to Kyiv ended with a passenger opening an emergency exit door and venturing out on the aircraft's wing — just for a bit of fresh air, apparently.</p><p>The Boeing 737-800 aircraft had just parked at the Ukrainian capital's Boryspil International Airport when the woman was heard complaining about being \"too hot,\" <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/passenger-takes-walk-on-airplane-wing/index.html\">CNN</a> reported, and used the overwing emergency exit as her own personal escape hatch. <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEkEaFmpZam/\">Video</a> shows the passenger sitting calmly near the rear edge of the wing before cabin crew arrived to call her back onto the plane, with the incident lasting only a few minutes.</p><p>The aircraft's canopy-style exit allowed the passenger to merely pull down on a lever and open the door. Overwing exits on the Boeing 737-800 do not come equipped with slides, unlike the forward and rear boarding doors. In an actual emergency, passengers are expected either to walk off of the aircraft via the rear flaps, or, in the event of a water landing, to wait on the wings.</p><p>Ukraine International Airlines and Boryspil International Airport did not immediately respond to Business Insider's request for comment, but told <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/passenger-takes-walk-on-airplane-wing/index.html\">CNN</a> that airport doctors and police examined the passenger and didn't find her to be under the influence of drugs or alcohol. The passenger was traveling on the two-hour flight from the Turkish leisure destination with her family.</p><p>Ukraine International Airlines has since banned the wing-walker from future&#160; flights, the airline told <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/passenger-takes-walk-on-airplane-wing/index.html\">CNN</a>. She may also be subject to a fine.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/WEN-5662-Blaster-13-5-Amp-Electric/dp/B00OFQEQPK?&_encoding=UTF8&tag=biipgf_112718_best-snow-blower-20&linkCode=ur2&linkId=88e4483362da669e4539d9aa420bb766&camp=1789&creative=9325p=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">WEN 5662 Snow Blaster Electric Snow Thrower</a></li><li>Best single-stage snow blower: <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.acehardware.com%2Fdepartments%2Flawn-and-garden%2Fsnow-removal-and-equipment%2Fsnow-blowers%2F7002861F7002861\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Toro Power Clear 721 E Gas Snow Blower</a></li><li>Best cordless electric snow blower: <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.acehardware.com%2Fdepartments%2Flawn-and-garden%2Fsnow-removal-and-equipment%2Fsnow-blowers%2F7804842F7804842\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">EGO SNT2102 Cordless Electric Snow Blower</a><a href=\"http://homedepot.sjv.io/c/196318/456723/8154?subId1=biipgf_112718_best-snow-blower&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.homedepot.com%2Fp%2FWEN-Snowblaster-18-in-Electric-Snow-Blower-5662%2F2055820922092\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow\"></a></li></ul><p><em>Prices and links are current as of 9/4/20. We also added a selection of related buying guides.</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best snow blower overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bfd75158c35ab197c3d7d07?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Toro_SnowMaster_snow_blower\" height=\"750\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Toro</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>If you want to remove snow from flat, paved surfaces as quickly and effortlessly as possible, the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.homedepot.com%2Fp%2FToro-SnowMaster-724-QXE-24-in-212cc-Single-Stage-Gas-Snow-Blower-36002%2F206125346\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Toro SnowMaster 724 QXE Gas Snow Blower</a> is the best.</h3><p>There are a few features that make the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.homedepot.com%2Fp%2FToro-SnowMaster-724-QXE-24-in-212cc-Single-Stage-Gas-Snow-Blower-36002%2F206125346\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Toro SnowMaster 724 QXE Gas Snow Blower</a> (model #36002) stand out. First, it's not a traditional single- or two-stage blower. It's more of a hybrid.</p><p>It has a single helical auger that moves 10 times faster than your usual two-stage blower. This sends the snow up to 40 feet away. The Personal Pace self-propel system moves the snow blower at your walking speed. And, a joystick allows you to adjust the chute direction and angle. The clearing width is 24 inches and the snow cut depth is 16 inches.</p><p>Toro sent me this snow blower to test in late 2018. The blower was delivered on a pallet by a semi-truck. The instructions for setting it up are pretty simple, and I had it up and running within half an hour of cutting into the box.&#160;</p><p>With this SnowMaster, I found the chore of removing snow to be enjoyable. It self-propels to match my gait, the joystick works smoothly for discharging the chute, and it could handle my gravel driveway and city sidewalks.</p><p>Like many things these days, there's a companion smartphone app. The MyToro app is a good concept but it needs improvement. The coolest function is it can automatically track how many hours you've used your Toro equipment and let you know when to perform maintenance. But for this function to work, you need to purchase the optional Portable Usage Calculator (PUC). I think Toro should have thrown this accessory in for free, but you can easily do this manually with pen and paper.</p><p>I've still been using this SnowMaster it has held up well after sitting in storage over summers. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/toro-snowmaster-snow-blower-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read more in my full review</a>.</p><p>Customers found the equipment to be easy to use and have a good size and weight. They also found that the Personal Pace function made the snow blower easy to maneuver.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Moves at your pace, fast, handles wet snow well, three-year limited warranty</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>May have trouble with uneven surfaces, smartphone app isn't that useful</p><h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.homedepot.com%2Fp%2FToro-SnowMaster-724-QXE-24-in-212cc-Single-Stage-Gas-Snow-Blower-36002%2F206125346\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Read our review of the Toro SnowMaster 724 QXE Gas Snow Blower</a></h3>\n\tThe best on a budget\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bfd75ca9e8c532c8a2fbd36?format=jpeg\" alt=\"WEN_ snow_blower\" height=\"999\" width=\"1332\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">WEN</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/WEN-5662-Blaster-13-5-Amp-Electric/dp/B00OFQEQPK?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_112718_best-snow-blower-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=88e4483362da669e4539d9aa420bb766&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">WEN 5662 Snow Blaster Electric Snow Thrower</a> is ideal for homeowners who are tired of shoveling and want a simple, affordable unit that clear walks and small paved driveways.</h3><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/WEN-5662-Blaster-13-5-Amp-Electric/dp/B00OFQEQPK?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_112718_best-snow-blower-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=88e4483362da669e4539d9aa420bb766&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">WEN 5662 Snow Blaster Electric Snow Thrower</a> is an electric, single-stage blower that relies on electricity provided by an extension cord. So, if you have a long driveway, this may not be a reasonable solution. But, for small jobs, it can be great with its 18-inch clearing width and 13.5-amp engine that is supposed to clear 490 pounds of snow per minute. The thrower only weighs about 39 pounds and is backed by a two-year warranty.</p><p>The WEN can handle even snow piles with ease, and that's it's quieter than a gas model. It's compact enough to store in a small garage or shed, and it's effective at clearing deep snow in one pass. If the snow is too wet or heavy, however, this machine tends to struggle, and the chute can get clogged. One annoying feature may be the safety switch that requires resetting when it turns off.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Affordable, lightweight, no need for gas, easy to assemble</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Clogs if the snow is too wet, have to mind the cord (not included)</p>\n\tThe best single-stage snow blower\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bfd757801b12d19d175f7a8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Toro_Power_snow_blower\" height=\"750\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Toro</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.acehardware.com%2Fdepartments%2Flawn-and-garden%2Fsnow-removal-and-equipment%2Fsnow-blowers%2F7002861\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Toro Power Clear 721 E Gas Snow Blower</a> is lightweight, self-propelled, and has a \"guaranteed to start\" warranty for the first two years.</h3><p>At 87 pounds, the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.acehardware.com%2Fdepartments%2Flawn-and-garden%2Fsnow-removal-and-equipment%2Fsnow-blowers%2F7002861\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Toro Power Clear 721 E Gas Snow Blower</a> is incredibly light for a gas-powered snow blower. This, along with the Power Propel self-propel system, make this single-stage unit easy to move around.</p><p>Another cool feature is the Toro \"Guaranteed to Start\" warranty, which states that the blower will start on the first or second pull every time in the first two years. If not, the company will fix it for free. The hard-plastic body has a 21-inch width, and the tough plastic auger makes constant contact with the surface for efficient clearing.</p><p>Though this model may have trouble with larger quantities of snow, it's maneuverability makes it great for tight driveways and regular maintenance. It also won't get clogged or bogged down by heavy wet snow thanks to its tough auger. Be mindful, however, if you have any gravel paths or rocky terrain as single-stage snow blowers can throw rocks and other small objects that may get pulled in.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Compact, lightweight, easy to maneuver, self-propelled, two-year full \"Guaranteed to Start\" warranty</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Not meant for heavy snowfalls, manual chute adjustment</p>\n\tThe best cordless electric snow blower\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bfd76d201b12d19d175f7b6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"EGO_snow_blower\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">EGO</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>If you don't want to bother with gas and snow in your area is measured in inches instead of feet, then the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.acehardware.com%2Fdepartments%2Flawn-and-garden%2Fsnow-removal-and-equipment%2Fsnow-blowers%2F7804842\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">EGO Cordless Electric Snow Blower</a>&#160;is your best bet.</h3><p>For a battery-powered snow blower, the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.acehardware.com%2Fdepartments%2Flawn-and-garden%2Fsnow-removal-and-equipment%2Fsnow-blowers%2F7804842\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">EGO SNT2102 Cordless Electric Snow Blower</a> can do a lot. It has a 21-inch clearing width and can handle snow up to 10 inches deep.</p><p>There are also two bright LED lights that will help you clear your drive before taking off for work in the morning. The SNT2102 comes with two 5.0 Ah batteries. The batteries last up to 45 minutes, and the charger takes 45 minutes to charge each battery. So, you may want to consider picking up extra batteries if you have a lot of area to clear.</p><p>Because it's battery-powered, it's much quieter than its gas counterparts. You also won't have to deal with fumes or refilling the tank. The push-button start is also quite the luxury for those accustomed to yanking pull cords to no avail season after season.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Runs quiet, no need for gas, features headlights, easy to assemble and store, lightweight</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Not self-propelled, only runs for about 30-45 minutes at a time (but charges quickly)</p>\n\tWhat to consider when buying a snow blower\n\t\n\t<p>When buying a snow blower, you should first consider where you want the power to come from. There are three main sources: gas, corded electric, and cordless electric or battery.</p><ul><li><strong>Gas </strong>snow blowers are the most popular, most powerful, and most expensive option. They also typically need more maintenance than the other two options.</li><li><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">Corded electric </strong>blowers are generally the least expensive and don't pollute, but just like a corded lawnmower, you have to mind the cord as you work, and it's not recommended for longer driveways due to the inherent cord-length limitations.</li><li><strong>Battery power</strong> avoids the cord problem, but batteries only last for so long before they need to be recharged. You can buy extra batteries so that you have enough to complete your job, but they are usually quite expensive.</li></ul><p>Snow blowers are either single-stage, two-stage, or three-stage.</p><ul><li>A <strong>single-stage snow blower</strong> (also referred to as a snow thrower) has an auger that moves very fast and sends the snow flying out of the chute in one step.</li><li><strong>Two-stage blowers</strong> have augers that feed the snow into the chute where a propeller throws the snow.</li><li><strong>Three-stage devices</strong> have augers that feed the snow into the center where it is chopped up and fed into the propeller</li></ul><p>Snow blowers with multiple stages tend to cost more, but they can also handle heavier-duty jobs and throw the snow farther.</p>\n\tCheck out our related home and gardening guides\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5248e7e6ff30001d4e7136?format=jpeg\" alt=\"dmos snow shovel\" height=\"993\" width=\"1325\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-snow-shovel\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best snow shovels</a></h3><p>Shoveling snow might not be much fun, but it need not be a loathsome burden, either. All you need is a great snow shovel to help you get the job done. These are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-snow-shovel\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">our top picks</a>.</p><hr /><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-ice-melt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best snow and ice melt</a></h3><p>High-quality ice melt is effective in temperatures well below zero. It melts ice quickly while keeping it from refreezing, and it won't do damage to your property. These are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-ice-melt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best snow and ice melts</a> you can buy.</p><hr /><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-winter-boots-men\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best winter boots for men</a></h3><p>With a great pair of winter boots on your feet, snow, ice, and the frigid temperatures won't stop you from having fun or getting your work done. These are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-winter-boots-men\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best men's winter boots</a>.</p><hr /><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-winter-boots-women\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best winter boots for women</a></h3><p>All too often, women's winter boots put fashion above function and you end up with cold wet feet. We tested dozens of winter boots to find the best ones for warmth, style, and comfort. 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"The Trump administration is looking at banning more Chinese apps, as TikTok sale talks stall","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-ban-chinese-apps-tiktok-security-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2f2fe9de1e9645817f04b4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tiktok china us flags\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>China and US flags are seen near a TikTok logo in this illustration picture taken July 16, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters/Florence Lo</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>White House chief of staff Mark Meadows said Thursday the US is looking at blocking more Chinese apps which put the country's national security at risk, per a CNBC report.</li>\n<li>Meadows' comments come as discussions around ByteDance's sale of TikTok in the US hit roadblocks thanks to China's intervention.</li>\n<li>Meadows didn't specify which apps could be banned, but he made similar remarks in August.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The US is set to ban more Chinese-owned apps that it believes pose a national security risk, according to reported remarks by Mark Meadows, the White House chief of staff.</p><p>Meadows was on board Air Force One when he made the remarks to reporters, but did not clarify which apps could be blocked.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/04/us-is-looking-at-banning-more-chinese-apps-over-national-security.html\">We saw the news via CNBC</a>.</p><p>Meadows' comments come amid a tussle over the fate of wildly popular video app TikTok in the US.</p><p>Trump has ordered the sale of TikTok's US data and business to an American bidder, or else face a ban from the country. Currently, TikTok's parent firm ByteDance is in discussions with at least two major bidders, Microsoft and Oracle. However, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tiktoks-us-sale-talks-hit-speed-bump-reports-2020-9\">China has thrown a spanner in these discussions</a> — and Trump's 90 day sale deadline — with new export laws that give it veto power over any deal.</p><p>Meadows made similar comments in August when he said the Trump administration was considering banning apps that may \"collect information and have potential national security risk,\" <a href=\"https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-usa-tiktok/trump-looked-at-banning-further-chinese-apps-in-addition-to-tiktok-meadows-idUKKCN25D27M\">Reuters</a> reported.</p><p>The US is not alone in challenging Chinese technology companies. India <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/india-bans-118-chinese-mobile-apps-amid-growing-tensions-border-2020-9\">banned 118 Chinese mobile apps</a> this week due to national security concerns.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/us-ban-chinese-apps-tiktok-security-2020-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Qu65VZNyEc0:aaG8g4guq24:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Qu65VZNyEc0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 14:35:59 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f523fd6e6ff30001d4e7102?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"6183b84947961035403bf6a8be6d4b71","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn70@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-37-34-107_46a8b99b0109696e.webp","destWidth":2222,"destHeight":1666,"sourceBytes":93608,"destBytes":93608,"author":"insider@insider.com (Kate Duffy)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f2f2fe9de1e9645817f04b4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn19@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-37-54-359_f5560582154a0fd0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-03-978_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Qu65VZNyEc0:aaG8g4guq24:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn72@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-06-069_34a3fd507d385c0a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Qu65VZNyEc0:aaG8g4guq24:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn31@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-37-56-259_6a41863aa77f3ece.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-085_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Qu65VZNyEc0:aaG8g4guq24:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn83@2020_4/2020/09/04/16-37-51-871_004766f2550cb613.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Qu65VZNyEc0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn4@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-37-49-970_aaf4eb73f5e6aeb3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599237433625},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"2 maps reveal the hotspots driving Mexico's worsening violence","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/maps-reveal-the-hotspots-driving-worsening-violence-in-mexico-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f524ac37ed0ee001e25d7e0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mexico City homicide crime scene\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A police investigator takes notes at a crime scene where a man was gunned down by unknown assailants outside a garage in Mexico City, February 12, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Luis Cortes</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>So far in 2020, 22 of Mexico's 32 states have seen a decrease in homicides, but the country as a whole has seen a 1% increase.</li>\n<li>That upward trend is driven by a few violent hotspots: Five states have over 30 homicides per 100,000 population and an increase of more than 10% this year, according to James Bosworth, author of the Latin America Risk Report newsletter.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p><em>This is an excerpt from <a href=\"https://boz.substack.com/p/two-maps-on-mexicos-security-situation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"d2fdd9ff832de3fc05591dd881f56632\">a recent edition</a> of the <a href=\"https://boz.substack.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"072246e9fa68ce3fc9a486ffa82cfa03\">Latin America Risk Report</a>, a newsletter by <a href=\"https://twitter.com/bloggingsbyboz\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"5d92ffd7e6421b426026bc6584b2a6ec\">James Bosworth</a>, founder of political-risk advisor <a href=\"https://www.hxagon.com/what-we-do\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"a97c41cc31748954d7874e7c8d0711eb\">Hxagon</a>.</em></p><h2>Violence in 5 states overwhelms security gains made elsewhere</h2><p>I have two new maps to share today. The first provides the number of <a href=\"https://www.datawrapper.de/_/ram7w/\">homicides per capita in each state</a> over the past 12 months in Mexico.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5242ac7ed0ee001e25d79f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"homicides in Mexico map\" height=\"1010\" width=\"1240\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Mexico homicide rate per 100,000 people data for July 2020 covering the previous 12 months.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://boz.substack.com/p/two-maps-on-mexicos-security-situation\" target=\"_blank\">Latin America Risk Report</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The second map looks at the <a href=\"https://www.datawrapper.de/_/DPBBk/\">percentage change in homicides</a> in the first seven months of 2020 vs. the first seven months in 2019.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5242ac7ed0ee001e25d79e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"homicides in Mexico map\" height=\"1012\" width=\"1240\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Percent change in homicides in Mexico from January to July 2020 vs. same time period in 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://boz.substack.com/p/two-maps-on-mexicos-security-situation\" target=\"_blank\">Latin America Risk Report</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>While Mexico has seen a 1% increase in homicides nationally in 2020, 22 of Mexico's 32 states have seen a decrease in homicides this year.</p><p>It's the states that are dark pink/red in both maps above that are the challenge. A few violent hotspots that are worsening overwhelm the security gains made elsewhere.</p><p>Five states have over 30 homicides per 100,000 population and an increase of more than 10% this year: Chihuahua, Sonora, Zacatecas, Guanajuato and Michoacan.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f524aad7ed0ee001e25d7df?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mexican army soldiers Chihuahua\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Soldiers check a vehicle at a check point in Janos, Chihuahua, January 9, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Carlos Jasso</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Chihuahua and Sonora</strong> — Sonora was once indisputably Sinaloa Cartel territory and relatively safer because of it. States that have a single criminal group dominating the landscape are usually safer than states where groups clash. Three things have happened to make Sonora a battleground.</p><p>After the arrest and extradition of El Chapo, the Sinaloa Cartel has seen its own top-down command and control diminish. It is increasingly reliant on small franchise groups that it does not totally control. This isn't a cartel civil war. The group is still relatively cohesive and does not have factions regularly shooting at each other. But that loss of unified command structure has increased the levels of violence.</p><p>The Sinaloa Cartel has aggressively pushed into Chihuahua to take on areas that have long been controlled by the Juarez Cartel. The Juarez cartel, in turn, has pushed in Sonora. That feud (with some CJNG prodding), has increased the violence in both states.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://boz.substack.com/p/tijuana-security-crisis-caused-by\">three-way battle</a> of Sinaloa vs CJNG/CTNG vs Tijuana Cartel remnants continues to cause high levels of violence in Baja California Norte. That fight has bled over into the western edge of Sonora, with the CJNG making a play for several coastal towns in the state.</p><p><strong>Zacatecas</strong> — If you want to move illicit goods including fentanyl from Guerrero, Michoacan, Colima or Jalisco to the northern border, the <a href=\"https://www.insightcrime.org/news/brief/fentanyl-trade-central-mexico/\">most viable routes run through Zacatecas</a>. Geographically, the state is uncomfortably in between the territories of the largest criminal groups in Mexico, making it a battleground.</p><p>The CJNG has pushed into Zacatecas in the past 12 months, making <a href=\"https://mexiconewsdaily.com/news/cartel-puts-on-a-show-of-force-with-25-vehicle-convoy/\">public shows of force</a> in areas that were previously considered Sinaloa or Zetas territory. Adding to the tensions and violence, the prison situation in the state is more complicated because prisoners from so many rival groups are held in the same locations.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec55950f34d054e3b49bac9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: Soldiers talks to a man at a crime scene after unknown assailants attacked a workshop leaving several casualties, according to local media, in Celaya, in Guanajuato state, Mexico March 31, 2020. REUTERS/Sergio Maldonado/File Photo\" height=\"3366\" width=\"5048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Mexican soldiers talk to a man at a crime scene after unknown assailants attacked a workshop in Celaya, in Guanajuato, March 31, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Guanajuato</strong> — I've covered Guanajuato's violence several times over the past two years. Oil theft, extortion and drug trafficking led to a violent battle between the CSRL and CJNG. The AMLO administration has recently claimed that violence is going down due to the <a href=\"https://boz.substack.com/p/mexico-the-capture-of-el-marro-august\">capture of El Marro</a>, the leader of the CSRL.</p><p>Lopez Obrador's often grabs on to short term (one or two week) trends to promote successes on security policies. Unfortunately, over the past 10 years, the removal of top criminal leaders led to greater violence more often than it led to less violence. It has been more violent in 2020, and AMLO shouldn't declare victory until he sees several consecutive months of reduced violence.</p><p><strong>Michoacan</strong> — This was the first state where President Calderon sent the military in 2006, an action that many regard as the start of the current era of conflict. While other states have seen ebbs and flows of conflict over the past 15 years, Michoacan has seen an almost steady worsening as a variety of groups (including La Familia, Knights Templar, Los Viagras and the CJNG) have fought for dominance.</p><p>In 2020, the CJNG continues to battle against a diverse set of local groups. The Lopez Obrador government's failure to respond forcefully to CJNG ambushes of government security forces in late 2019 was a demonstration of the government's inability to set a red line for criminal violence. The CJNG is emboldened to push forward and eliminate their rivals.</p><h2>The CJNG expansion and the Lopez Obrador government's failure to respond are the problem</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f524aa8e6ff30001d4e714b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mexico Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador AMLO\" height=\"533\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador at his daily news conference in Mexico City, February 14, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Carlos Jasso</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>In Zacatecas, Guanajuato and Michoacan, the key driver of violence is the CJNG expansion. That is also true to a lesser extent in Sonora. The Lopez Obrador government has been slow to counter the CJNG and has arguably been more focused on the group's rivals in each of those states.</p><p>Looking at that maps above, two additional states — San Luis Potosi and Hidalgo — have also seen an increase that is of concern. While both of these states remain safer than the five states I wrote about above, their notable homicide increase this year should be a red flag for Mexican authorities and companies operating in Mexico. In both cases, the CJNG has moved in and fought against local groups including remnants of the Gulf Cartel and Zetas.</p><p>The Lopez Obrador government's failure to respond to the worst cases of rising violence is the unifying factor in all the states listed above. From the <a href=\"https://boz.substack.com/p/mexico-security-update-7-november\">massacre</a> of the LaBaron family in Sonora to the ambushes of police patrols in Guanajuato and Michoacan, AMLO has failed to detain, prosecute and convict those responsible. The National Guard has been spread thin across nearly every state and diverted to blocking and detaining Central America migrants instead of providing focused security to the highest risk areas.</p><h2>Thanks for reading. One more note</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f524ab2e6ff30001d4e714d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mexico Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador AMLO baseball softball\" height=\"1747\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Lopez Obrador bats in an exhibition softball game in Muna, Yucatán State, September 21, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Presidential Press Office/Handout via REUTERS</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Yucatan</strong> — It's the safest state in the country. I wanted to stress that as I know someone is going to see that map above and wonder why Yucatan is dark red in terms of the increase in homicides. It sometimes happens when dealing with small numbers. The state saw 26 homicides in the first seven months of this year vs. 16 over the same time period in 2019.</p><p>It's a large increase in terms of percentages, but not a strategically important issue. Yucatan is also the state where homicides are most likely to be investigated and prosecuted, a fact that is not coincidental to its security. Alejandro Hope had a great column last year on \"<a href=\"https://www.eluniversal.com.mx/opinion/alejandro-hope/la-excepcion-yucateca\">La excepción yucateca</a>\" for those that want to read more.</p><p>If you found today's newsletter interesting, please feel free to share it via email and social media.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/maps-reveal-the-hotspots-driving-worsening-violence-in-mexico-2020-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
