border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/S0dbCMkGFQI\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 14:41:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f5237abe6ff30001d4e70eb?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"2493c05827535e81330a8dac285c20d2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn18@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-37-48-745_e18e852b66f6097a.webp","destWidth":1842,"destHeight":1382,"sourceBytes":59174,"destBytes":59174,"author":"tclark@businessinsider.com (Travis Clark)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f22ca7e3ad8616ba336d3aa?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn64@2020_4/2020/09/04/16-37-55-092_da2b710a81839564.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-03-978_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=S0dbCMkGFQI:2TcsWr3ayQg:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-147_8c1d9b057b9af690.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=S0dbCMkGFQI:2TcsWr3ayQg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn77@2020_3/2020/09/04/16-38-05-338_d50356c6476a6e29.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-085_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=S0dbCMkGFQI:2TcsWr3ayQg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-38-01-041_eeeec0ac3c45c695.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/S0dbCMkGFQI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn19@2020_3/2020/09/04/16-37-57-695_cd5d71f5b96fa505.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599237433626},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"How Ivy League financial aid packages stack up, even amid the coronavirus pandemic","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-ivy-league-financial-aid-packages-stack-up-coronavirus-tuition-2020-7","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f15d85a5af6cc3a930cec19?format=jpeg\" alt=\"harvard coronavirus graduation\" height=\"2438\" width=\"3251\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ivy League schools aren&#39;t curbing their high tuition prices amid the pandemic, but most already offer free tuition for students from families with a yearly income under $65,000.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Craig F. Walker/The Boston Globe via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Ivy League colleges are by and large not reducing tuition this fall, even though instruction will mostly be online due to the coronavirus pandemic.</li>\n<li>Full tuition at an Ivy League college typically falls between $50,000 and $60,000 per year.</li>\n<li>All eight Ivy League schools provide comprehensive financial aid packages. The majority offer free tuition to students from families earning less than $65,000 per year.</li>\n<li>Below, Business Insider compiled each school's basic financial aid offering, along with the full price of tuition and each school's coronavirus reopening plan.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/18/opinion/college-education-coronavirus.html\">Some have lamented</a> that the coronavirus crisis has rendered the Ivy League a glorified version of the University of Phoenix, with <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/14/colleges-move-online-amid-coronavirus-but-forget-a-tuition-discount.html\">sky high tuition</a> to boot.</p><p>An Ivy League education costs somewhere between $50,000 and $60,000 per year — and that's just the tuition. Room, board, and other student fees then push that baseline up by thousands. The average tuition and fees at public colleges are typically <a href=\"https://www.usnews.com/education/best-colleges/paying-for-college/articles/2019-06-25/the-cost-of-private-vs-public-colleges#:~:text=The%20average%20cost%20of%20tuition,out%2Dof%2Dstate%20students.\">much lower</a>.</p><p>All eight prestigious Ivy League colleges, however, provide comprehensive financial aid packages. For the most part, students from families making less than $65,000 per year can attend an Ivy League school for free.</p><p>The full price of tuition remains unchanged at most colleges amid the coronavirus pandemic, though, even as the majority of schools plan to rely <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-major-us-colleges-plan-reopen-for-fall-2020-semester-2020-5\">heavily on remote learning</a> this fall. Princeton opted to institute a 10% tuition cut, while other schools reiterated that the quality of instruction would remain the same amid remote learning, so tuition would remain the same, too.</p><p>Below, Business Insider rounded up the financial aid offerings at each Ivy League school. Full tuition prices, along with fall reopening plans, are also included. The schools are listed in alphabetical order.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tBrown University\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f15b9fa5af6cc2b5b182888?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Brown University\" height=\"1155\" width=\"1540\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Brown University&#39;s campus in Providence, Rhode Island on April 25, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lane Turner/The Boston Globe via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Families with total parental earnings lower than $60,000 and assets of less than $100,000 are not required to make a parental contribution toward the cost of education at <a href=\"http://www.brown.edu/about/administration/financial-aid/general-questions\">Brown.</a> The school determines aid based on demonstrated financial need, and does not provide merit-based scholarships.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/financial-aid/office-financial-aid-frequently-asked-questions-academic-year-2020-21\">baseline cost</a> of a full year's tuition at Brown is $59,254. The coronavirus pandemic has not impacted that figure.</p><p>The school is planning a <a href=\"https://www.brown.edu/sites/g/files/dprerj316/files/healthy-brown-2020-21-plan.pdf\">hybrid approach</a> to reopening, allowing some students on campus this fall while much of the instruction will remain online.</p>\n\tColumbia University\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f15bb3a4dca684aa55be367?format=jpeg\" alt=\"columbia university\" height=\"2871\" width=\"3828\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Columbia University&#39;s library amid the coronavirus pandemic in New York City.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alexi Rosenfeld/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>For students coming from families with calculated total incomes of less than $60,000 annually, parents are not expected to contribute to the cost of attendance. For students coming from families with calculated total incomes between $60,000 and $100,000 annually, <a href=\"https://cc-seas.financialaid.columbia.edu/how/aid/works\">Columbia</a> offers a reduced parent contribution.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://cc-seas.financialaid.columbia.edu/eligibility/facts\">baseline cost</a> of a full year's tuition at Columbia is $61,850. The coronavirus pandemic has not impacted that figure.</p><p>The school is planning a <a href=\"https://president.columbia.edu/news/plans-coming-academic-year\">hybrid approach</a> to reopening, where classes will be offered in multiple formats.</p>\n\tCornell University\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5efdfa0d3ad86112c7531a6a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cornell university\" height=\"1423\" width=\"1897\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Students on Cornell University&#39;s Ithaca, New York campus.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Cornell University</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Families with total parent earnings less than $60,000 and assets of less than $100,000 are not required to make a parental contribution toward the cost of education for students attending&#160;<a href=\"https://finaid.cornell.edu/cost-attend/financial-aid-initiatives\">Cornell</a>.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://finaid.cornell.edu/cost-attend/cornell%E2%80%99s-commitment-access-and-affordability\">baseline cost</a> of a full year's tuition at Cornell is $58,586. The coronavirus pandemic has not impacted that figure.</p><p>The school is maintaining the <a href=\"https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2020/03/cornell-reaffirms-financial-aid-commitment-amid-crisis\">3.6% rise in tuition</a> it announced in March. Cornell is planning a to reopen in the fall based on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cornell-researchers-deem-reopening-campus-safer-than-online-classes-2020-7\">\"counterintuitive\" evidence</a> that doing so will actually lead to fewer coronavirus infections than a fully remote semester.</p>\n\tDartmouth College\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f15ca51aee6a83df13e2e68?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Darmouth College\" height=\"4606\" width=\"6142\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Students at Dartmouth College in Hanover, New Hampshire in June 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sarah Rice for The Washington Post via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Free tuition is offered at <a href=\"http://admissions.dartmouth.edu/financial-aid/how-aid-works/how-much-help-will-i-get\">Dartmouth</a> for students coming from families making less than $100,000.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://financialaid.dartmouth.edu/cost-attendance/cost-attendance\">baseline cost</a> of a full year's tuition at Dartmouth is $57,796. The coronavirus pandemic has not impacted that figure.&#160;</p><p>Dartmouth is planning a <a href=\"https://news.dartmouth.edu/news/2020/06/dartmouth-announces-plans-coming-academic-year?utm_source=dhome&#38;utm_medium=referral&#38;utm_campaign=carousel\">hybrid return</a> in the fall, with half of the student body on campus and instruction available remotely.</p>\n\tHarvard University\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f15cb1a3f737077e369b858?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Harvard\" height=\"3840\" width=\"5120\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Harvard students on the Cambridge, Massachusetts campus on July 8, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Anik Rahman/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Students from families with incomes below $65,000 are not expected to contribute toward the cost of attending <a href=\"https://college.harvard.edu/financial-aid/how-aid-works\">Harvard</a>. Families with incomes between $65,000 and $150,000 will contribute from 0% to 10% of income, depending on individual circumstances. Families with incomes above $150,000 are expected to pay above 10% of their income, also based on their individual circumstances.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.harvard.edu/about-harvard/harvard-glance\">baseline cost</a> of a full year's tuition at Harvard is $49,653. The coronavirus pandemic has not impacted that figure.</p><p>The school is planning for a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/harvard-announces-all-remote-semester-with-freshmen-allowed-on-campus-2020-7\">remote semester,</a> but also plans to allow 40% of its undergraduate student body to return to campus.</p>\n\tThe University of Pennsylvania\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f15cf8a4dca6853a1706717?format=jpeg\" alt=\"University of Pennsylvania\" height=\"3291\" width=\"4388\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Students walk through the University of Pennsylvania campus.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ann Hermes/The Christian Science Monitor via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Students from families with incomes below $65,500 will generally pay nothing toward the cost of attending <a href=\"http://www.sfs.upenn.edu/paying/paying-pro-look-at-the-facts.htm\">Penn.</a> They will receive financial aid packages that cover tuition, room, and board. Students coming from families with income below $140,000 also generally receive financial aid packages that cover tuition.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://srfs.upenn.edu/costs-budgeting/undergraduate-cost-attendance\">baseline cost</a> of a full year's tuition at Penn is $53,166. The coronavirus pandemic has not impacted that figure.</p><p>Penn is planning a <a href=\"https://penntoday.upenn.edu/announcements/message-community-about-penns-plans-fall-semester\">hybrid return</a> in the fall, with a combination of online learning and in-person instruction.</p>\n\tPrinceton University\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f15d1472618b97b952da233?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Princeton University\" height=\"1929\" width=\"2571\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Students walk on campus at Princeton University on February 4, 2020 in Princeton, New Jersey.\n<p class=\"copyright\">William Thomas Cain/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Students from families with incomes below $65,000 receive a financial aid package that covers full tuition, room, and board. All families making up to $180,000 per year qualified for financial aid at <a href=\"https://admission.princeton.edu/cost-aid/financial-aid-numbers\">Princeton</a>.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://admission.princeton.edu/cost-aid/fees-payment-options\">baseline cost</a> of a full year's tuition at Princeton is $48,502 &#8212; roughly a <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/education/2020/07/06/harvard-reopen-with-fewer-than-half-undergrads-campus-because-coronavirus/\">10% discount</a> from the normal figure, due to the coronavirus.</p><p>Princeton is planning a <a href=\"https://fall2020.princeton.edu/\">remote fall</a>, with certain students allowed to return to campus.</p>\n\tYale University\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f15d442988ee3720d3bdf14?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yale students\" height=\"1329\" width=\"1771\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Students walk on Yale&#39;s New Haven, Connecticut campus in 2018.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Yana Paskova/Stringer/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Families with income less than $65,000 are not expected to make any financial contribution towards their child's education at <a href=\"http://admissions.yale.edu/financial-aid-prospective-students\">Yale</a>. Families earning up to $200,000 will contribute a percentage of their yearly income, on a sliding scale that moves toward 20%. All students with demonstrated financial need receive aid.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://admission.princeton.edu/cost-aid/fees-payment-options\">baseline cost</a> of a full year's tuition at Yale is $57,700. The coronavirus pandemic has not impacted that figure.</p><p>Yale is planning a <a href=\"https://www.princeton.edu/news/2020/07/06/princeton-announces-plan-fall-2020-guidelines-undergraduates-returning-campus\">hybrid approach to the fall.</a> While most classes will be taught remotely, roughly half of the student body would be on campus at any given time.</p><p><em>Abby Jackson and Catherine Rice contributed to previous versions of this story.</em></p>\n</div><div 9_4a1e80c953c025bb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-085_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ehL44x7NSHE:rWWKMo5ZDp4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn7@2020_4/2020/09/04/16-37-59-813_268d44fc865efa52.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ehL44x7NSHE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn44@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-38-04-949_c1dd3a089b68d3c1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599237433650},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"Pret a Manger launches UK's first barista coffee subscription service","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pret-a-manger-launches-uks-first-coffee-subscription-service-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f522b4c7ed0ee001e25d769?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Pret a Manger coffee\" height=\"682\" width=\"909\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">JUSTIN TALLIS/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Pret a Manger will offer customers up to five barista drinks a day through its new subscription service which costs &#163;20 ($26.60) a month.</li>\n<li>Coffee sales have risen at a faster rate than food sales for the UK coffee and sandwich chain since its stores reopened in May.</li>\n<li>You won't be able to order for your friends &#8211; customers have to wait 30 minutes between each drink ordered using the service.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>UK sandwich and coffee chain Pret a Manger is debuting a new subscription service to try to shore up its business that has been all but deserted for months after the Covid-19 pandemic kept millions of office workers, commuters and other customers at home.&#160;&#160;</p><p>For £20 ($26.60) a month, customers can get up to five drinks a day from Pret's&#160;YourPret Barista service that launches next Tuesday.</p><p>This will be the first such drink subscription model on UK high streets, according to the company, and marks an important step in Pret's digital transformation as it adapts to a changing customer landscape.</p><p>Pret, whose dark-red fronted stores are ubiquitous in financial districts, town and city centers, as well as around train and subway stations, is introducing the service to drive demand after sales collapsed during the pandemic.</p><p>The subscription service marks a shift in focus for Pret, which is owned by German conglomerate JAB Holdings, whose brands include Krispi Kreme doughnuts, soft-drink labels Dr Pepper and Schweppes and Kenco coffee.</p><p>The outlet is a lunchtime favorite among office workers, but CEO Pano Christou said that coffee sales have risen more quickly than food sales since stores reopened in May.</p><p>The service will operate via either Apple or Google digital wallets or QR codes, which are emailed to subscribers, and will be free in its first month.</p><p>The subscription will include all barista-made coffees, teas, hot chocolates, smoothies, and frappe drinks. Customers have to wait 30 minutes between each order using the service to prevent people buying drinks wastefully or for friends without subscriptions.</p><p>Pret described the service as a \"flagship offering\" in the company's plan to turn around its finances that have been hit hard by the pandemic. The chain said last week it <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pret-a-manger-job-cuts-third-uk-workforce-sales-slump-2020-8\">will cut around 2,800 jobs</a> in its UK stores, after weekly sales dropped to 2010 levels – when the chain had half as many branches.</p><p>Pret had previously announced that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pret-a-manger-cuts-1000-jobs-closes-30-locations-2020-7\">30 of its 440 UK stores would close</a> by 2021, after sales fell by 74% in the period from March to late June this year, compared to 2019.</p><p>However, sales have grown by an average of 7% each week since July, helped by the UK government's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/eat-out-to-help-out-costs-uk-567-million-2020-9\">Eat Out to Help Out scheme</a> which offered diners half-price meals in August.</p><div 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"Peloton is launching a cheaper treadmill and a new premium bike, as the fitness powerhouse tries to muscle its way into more American homes","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/peloton-is-reportedly-launching-cheaper-treadmill-and-a-premium-bike-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f524a93e6ff30001d4e714a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Peloton Bike Lifestyle 01\" height=\"1101\" width=\"1468\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Peloton</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Peloton is reportedly planning to launch a cheaper version of its treadmill and a new premium stationary bike, sources close to the matter told Bloomberg.&#160;</li>\n<li>The treadmill is slated to retail for $3,000, while the high-end bike is expected to cost more than Peloton's existing $2,245 model.</li>\n<li>In response to Business Insider's request to comment, Peloton said \"we can't comment on rumors and have nothing to announce.\"</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Peloton is reportedly gearing up to drop cheaper versions of its existing stationary bike and treadmill, while also adding a new premium bike model to the mix.&#160;</p><p>The new treadmill — which will be smaller and developed using a cheaper design structure — is slated to cost $3,000, down from $4,295, sources close to the matter <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-04/peloton-readies-cheaper-treadmill-new-bike-in-pandemic-push?sref=p7zS9UoY\">told Bloomberg</a>. The cheaper treadmill is expected to be called Tread, while the current model will be renamed to Tread+.</p><p>Bloomberg also reported that Peloton plans to launch a high-end Bike+ that will retail for more than the $2,245 current model that is separately slated to drop to $1,900 in the near future. Peloton CEO John Foley first hinted at a forthcoming <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/peloton-considers-cheaper-version-of-bike-to-grow-customer-base-2020-5\">cheaper bike option in May</a> as part of an effort to democratize its high-tech fitness products and reach new consumers.&#160;</p><p>\"We want to make our products even more affordable than they are today,\" Foley said in an <a href=\"https://time.com/5839552/peloton-ceo-john-foley/\">interview with Time</a>. \"If we can get those monthly payments down, we can really open it up. And we want everyone in every socioeconomic class to be able to afford Peloton. That's a big focus for us in the coming years,\" he said.&#160;</p><p>Bloomberg's sources divulged that both Bike+ and the less expensive Tread will feature more adjustable tablet screens than previous models. The flexibility of the screens will allow for users to also do mat and strength training workouts near the machine, as the company prepares to add additional streaming workout classes, the sources said.&#160;</p><p>In response to Business Insider's request to comment, Peloton said \"we can't comment on rumors and have nothing to announce.\" However, Bloomberg anticipates the company may announce the products next week, in advance of its quarterly earnings call on September 10.</p><p>Peloton has experienced a significant uptick in demand during the pandemic as Americans seek out at-home fitness options like stationary bikes. The company's sales in the first quarter of 2020 <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/peloton-customers-complain-delays-cancellations-during-lockdown-2020-6\">increased by 66%</a> and subscribers to the Peloton app jumped by 94%.</p><p>Though Peloton announced in June that it was increasing production to meet overwhelming demand that prompted significant delays and last-minute cancellations, its bikes still remain on weeks-long backorder.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/peloton-is-reportedly-launching-cheaper-treadmill-and-a-premium-bike-2020-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f524a93e6ff30001d4e714a?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0d5851ddee99421e02aab6fb5173f2c3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn35@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-37-13-983_42972eb24cad80bd.webp","destWidth":1468,"destHeight":1101,"sourceBytes":76040,"destBytes":76040,"author":"insider@insider.com (Bethany Biron)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f524a93e6ff30001d4e714a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn35@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-37-13-983_42972eb24cad80bd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-03-978_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8xfcrXGSFvg:S3PFj-ZsPF4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn27@2020_3/2020/09/04/16-37-34-170_fc7101ffde211267.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8xfcrXGSFvg:S3PFj-ZsPF4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn15@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-04-900_0a955c5e233e6ac1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-085_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8xfcrXGSFvg:S3PFj-ZsPF4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn79@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-35-895_7efceee5a38a66bc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8xfcrXGSFvg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn15@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-38-01-025_97e892f53a8ab8d8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599237433603},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"8 roles parents should play if they want their kids to be successful, according to Harvard research","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/successful-children-have-parents-who-play-8-roles-harvard-researcher-2019-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e4457543ac0c9698254a679?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Child and parent\" height=\"1414\" width=\"1885\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The &#39;early learning partner&#39; is the most important role of the eight.\n<p class=\"copyright\">kali9/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Harvard&#160;professor&#160;Ronald Ferguson is author of \"The Formula: Unlocking the Secrets to Raising Highly Successful Children.\"</li>\n<li>After becoming fascinated with what parents did to shape his most talented students, he conducted research and determined that there are eight parental roles that make up the formula for master parenting.</li>\n<li>Being an \"early learning partner\" is the most crucial, he said, which helps kids become excited about gathering new information and succeeding.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.</a></li>\n</ul><p>Spotting patterns,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.inc.com/john-hall/how-your-company-can-keep-up-with-analytics-trends.html?cid=search\">trends</a>, and formulas make our work (and life) easier. But I never thought I'd see someone unlocking the formula for the hardest job of all: <a href=\"https://www.inc.com/scott-mautz/want-to-raise-a-happy-successful-child-a-43-year-study-says-youll-first-have-to-overcome-this.html\">raising super-successful children</a>.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.inc.com/tommy-mello/harvard-research-has-revealed-that-doing-this-one-thing-is-more-profitable-than-hiring-a-players.html?cid=search\">Harvard</a>&#160;professor&#160;Ronald Ferguson,&#160;author of \"<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Formula-Unlocking-Secrets-Successful-Children/dp/1946885061/ref=sr_1_1?crid=1QDSNG5Q6ISMT&keywords=the+formula+unlocking+the+secrets&qid=1555943033&s=books&sprefix=the+formula%2Cstripbooks%2C147&sr=1-1oks%2C147&#38;sr=1-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Formula: Unlocking the Secrets to Raising Highly Successful Children</a>,\" recently told the&#160;<a href=\"https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2019/04/harvards-ronald-ferguson-explores-how-to-raise-successful-children/?utm_source=SilverpopMailing&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=Daily%2520Gazette%252020190417%2520%281%290%281%29\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Harvard Gazette</a>&#160;he's done exactly that.</p><p>Ferguson was fascinated with what parents did to shape his talented students. So he and co-author Tatsha Robertson comprehensively studied how different parenting styles shape children's success. Test subjects included the youngest statewide elected official in the country and the mother of the CEOs of YouTube and the genetics company​ 23andMe.</p><p>What emerged?</p><p>Eight parental roles that Ferguson says make up the formula for master parenting. \"It was like a hidden pattern that gradually revealed itself — a set of widely recognized, well-researched qualities that are the basic success foundations.\"</p><p>Play these eight roles well and you'll ace parenting.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\t1. The 'early learning partner'\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf7c6be11e2050d5d6e1d68?format=jpeg\" alt=\"parent child gift\" height=\"644\" width=\"859\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Get kids interested in learning before they start school.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>This role has parents getting their child interested in learning at a young age, before they start school. Ferguson calls the early learning partner the most important role of the eight. The most successful kids can&#160;read basic words by kindergarten, and experience what Ferguson calls \"the early lead effect,\" where the child responds positively to a teacher's excitement that they can&#160;already read.</p>\n\t2. The 'flight engineer'\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d04124f6fc920128d67cdd3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"father son parent child\" height=\"1998\" width=\"2664\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>There&#39;s a difference between this and a helicopter parent.\n<p class=\"copyright\">KieferPix / Shutterstock.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>This is the parent monitoring the child's growth environment, making sure they're getting what they need and intervening when they're not.</p><p>This isn't the same as being a helicopter parent, who Ferguson says \"are so involved in their children's lives they don't create space for them to develop independent relationships, learn how to negotiate for themselves, or identify their own interests.\" My wife and I started playing this role when we encountered a teacher that wasn't giving our daughter a fair shake.</p>\n\t3. The 'fixer'\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d3ed9628d66424e595ed2b4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"parent child high five\" height=\"627\" width=\"836\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>They don&#39;t let a lack of resource get in their way.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Rawpixel.com/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In this role, the parent ensures no key opportunity for their child's betterment is lost &#8212; and they don't let a lack of resources slow them down.</p><p>As Ferguson says, \"The parents might be living in poverty, but if they see an opportunity they judge to be essential for their child's success in school or life, they'll walk through walls to get it.\"</p>\n\t4. The 'revealer'\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/59286cb4b74af449018b4a8f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mother child sweden parent\" height=\"750\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>They help their child discover the world.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Revealer parents help their child discover the world by going to museums, libraries, exhibits, etc. &#8212; anything to expand their worldview. Again, this happens even with a lack of resources; revealer parents get creative in how to accommodate such outings. My wife and I have given this one extra focus, since we're fans of experiences over things.</p>\n\t5. The 'philosopher'\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a21c74e3dbef4ae078b992d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"dad daughter parent kid child\" height=\"667\" width=\"889\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>This role helps kids find purpose.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dina Uretski/Shutterstock.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Ferguson says this is the second most important role, because it helps children find purpose. Here, the parents ask and answer deep life questions, never underestimating a child's capacity to understand life and grasp the idea of meaning. I've been astonished at how early my daughter grasped these big ideas.</p>\n\t6. The 'model'\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5baa687227ca74a05c8b4567?format=jpeg\" alt=\"parent mother daughter child teen parenting communication\" height=\"1914\" width=\"2552\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>They embody the values that are important to them.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Monkey Business Images/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>This is classic role-modeling. Parents who do this well are clear about which values are important to them and work hard to pass those values on to their children, who then aspire to emulate them. My wife and I try to live our core values each day &#8212; but that doesn't mean it comes easy, or that we always succeed.</p>\n\t7. The 'negotiator'\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cb64be0d2ce785ca6712667?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mom son child talking to kid\" height=\"664\" width=\"885\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>This teaches kids to stand up for themselves — respectfully.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ivan Marjanovic/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>This role teaches the child to be respectful while standing up for themselves and what they believe in (especially in the face of those with power and authority).</p>\n\t8. The 'GPS navigational voice'\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c98f7ef2cc74048ea0763c8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"adult child with parent\" height=\"1141\" width=\"1522\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>This is the parents&#39; voice staying in the child&#39;s head, even when they&#39;ve left home.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Betsie Van Der Meer/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Ferguson described this as, \"The parents' voice in the child's head after the child has left home, coaching the young adult through new situations in life.\" I can only hope our daughter's GPS never says \"recalculating,\" given the work we've done to try and keep it on course.</p><p>Reassuringly, the Harvard researcher said that the most important quality for parents to exhibit as they wear these different hats is simply the determination to be a great parent. He calls this motivation \"the burn,\" and says it often comes out of things in the parents' histories:</p><blockquote><p><em>It could be something that went wrong in their own childhoods that they didn't want repeated for their own children. It could be a family legacy of excellence in some domain that they felt a responsibility to pass on to their offspring. Or some commitment that the family had, for example, to civil rights, that they wanted their children to honor. But each of these parents had a vision of the kind of person they wanted their children to become. That vision, along with the burn, guided and inspired their parenting.</em></p></blockquote><p>So whatever your \"burn\" is, use it to play these eight roles well. None of the roles are always easy, but all of them are important for giving your child every chance to succeed.</p><p><em>This Inc. story was originally published on Business Insider April 30, 2019.</em></p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a c35a1a9bb2987.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-085_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=InXMJp2ek60:tH2__Lv3TXw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn39@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-38-06-647_f8d4a073b9e49ac6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/InXMJp2ek60":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn4@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-48-636_5c27f16e0f93d785.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599237433614},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"Every new movie you can watch on Disney Plus — from the live-action 'Mulan' to the Broadway musical 'Hamilton'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-movies-disney-plus","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ee7bb264dca68191e0bf3f5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"New movies disney plus 4x3\" height=\"2500\" width=\"3334\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Disney&#43;; Alyssa Powell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Disney Plus</a> subscribers can stream brand-new feature-length films alongside their favorite Disney movies.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>The current lineup of original films includes titles like the Broadway musical \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-hamilton-movie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hamilton</a>,\" the live-action \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-mulan-movie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mulan</a>,\" and Beyoncé's new visual album \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-black-is-king-beyonce-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Black Is King</a>.\"</strong></li><li><strong>An annual Disney Plus subscription costs $69.99 while a monthly plan is $6.99 a month.</strong></li><li>For detailed impressions, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">check out our full review of Disney Plus here</a>.</li></ul><div id=\"ProductCard_5dc5bb627eece5443d2df8b9\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5dc5bb627eece5443d2df8b9&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5dded3e0fd9db2366f10b6d6\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5dded3e0fd9db2366f10b6d6&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/PZZVR\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Disney Plus</a> streaming library features an extensive collection of movies, including many <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kids-movies-on-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Disney</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pixar-movies-on-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Pixar</a> classics, virtually every movie from the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/star-wars-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Star Wars</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/marvel-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Marvel</a> franchises, several <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/national-geographic-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">National Geographic</a> documentaries, and tons more.</p><p>There are even brand-new feature films made exclusively for Disney Plus, like a live-action \"Lady and the Tramp\" and the holiday comedy \"Noelle.\" Disney Plus also features exclusive musicals, like \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-hamilton-movie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hamilton</a>\" and \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-black-is-king-beyonce-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Black Is King</a>.\" For documentary fans, there are plenty of Disneynature movies featured as well, including \"Elephant,\" \"Dolphin Reef,\" and more. Subscribers can also gain early streaming access to select movies, like \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-mulan-movie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mulan</a>,\" for an extra fee.</p><p>Additional original movies are also in the works, with new titles set to be released throughout the year and beyond.</p><p><em>Updated on 9/4/2020 by Steven Cohen: Added details about the Disney Plus release of \"Mulan\" on September 4.</em></p><h2>What is Disney Plus and how much does it cost?</h2><p>Disney Plus is a streaming service with a huge array of existing and new movies and shows from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic, and 20th Century Fox.</p><p>An annual subscription costs <a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/PZZVR\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow\">$69.99 a year</a> while a monthly subscription costs $6.99 a month. Though a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus-free-trial\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">free seven-day trial</a> was initially offered for new subscribers, this promotion is no longer available. A <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus-bundle\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">bundle with Hulu and ESPN+</a> is available for $12.99 a month.</p><p>Here's everything you need to know <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">about the service along with plan breakdowns</a>. You can also <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">read our full review of Disney Plus here</a>.</p><h2>What Disney movies are available on Disney Plus?</h2><p>There are classic Disney films, like \"Snow White\" and \"Mary Poppins,\" recent releases, like \"Frozen 2\" and \"Moana,\" nearly everything from the Star Wars and Marvel franchises, and even more obscure fare, like \"The Computer Wore Sneakers\" and \"Sammy, the Way-Out Seal<em>.</em>\"&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/PZZVR\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Disney Plus</a> is also home to a growing collection of original movies produced exclusively for the streaming service. Some original titles available right now include the live-action version of \"Lady and the Tramp,\" the holiday comedy \"Noelle,\" the coming-of-age film \"Stargirl,\" and the fantasy movie \"Artemis Fowl.\"&#160;</p><p>Other notable Disney Plus exclusives include the live-action \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-mulan-movie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mulan</a>,\" a filmed version of the Broadway musical \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-hamilton-movie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hamilton</a>,\" and Beyoncé's&#160; visual album \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-black-is-king-beyonce-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Black is King</a>.\"&#160;Several Disneynature documentaries are also now available through Disney Plus, including \"Diving with Dolphins,\" \"Elephant,\" and more.</p><p>Over the coming months and years, <a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/PZZVR\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Disney Plus</a> will be rolling out even more exclusive movies, with offerings generally geared toward families. Below, we've compiled a complete list of all the Disney Plus exclusive movies announced so far.</p><h2>Here are all the new films to stream on <a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/PZZVR\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Disney Plus</a>:</h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\t'Mulan' - Premier Access available now\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2c0fef988ee35dd9597605?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mulan Disney Plus\" height=\"882\" width=\"1176\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">IMDB</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-mulan-movie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mulan</a>\" is a new live-action retelling of the classic Chinese folk story. The movie stars Yifei Liu as the titular hero. The story was previously adapted into an animated Disney movie in 1998.</p><p>Though originally intended for a theatrical release, \"Mulan\" instead debuted on Disney Plus in the US as a result of theater closures due to the coronavirus pandemic. The movie is currently available to subscribers as a \"Premier Access\" title for an additional $29.99 fee.&#160;</p><p>The Premier Access purchase option will remain available through November 2. \"Mulan\" will then be available for all Disney Plus subscribers without an extra fee starting December 4.</p>\n\t'Hamilton' - available now\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/576c47ca52bcd026008cb5b8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hamilton Musical Lin Manuel Miranda\" height=\"929\" width=\"1239\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=deApjIhhhC4\" target=\"_blank\">Broadwaycom/Youtube</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Based on the Broadway musical, \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-hamilton-movie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hamilton</a>\" focuses on the life of American Founding Father Alexander Hamilton. Lin-Manuel Miranda plays the title character and is also the composer of the musical's soundtrack.&#160; The movie version of \"Hamilton\" was filmed at the Richard Rodgers Theatre in 2016, and stars the original cast of the Broadway show.&#160;</p><p>\"Hamilton\" premiered exclusively on Disney Plus on July 3. The film is available in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-hdr-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dolby Vision HDR</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-dolby-atmos\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dolby Atmos audio</a> through supported devices.</p>\n\t'Black Is King' - available now\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2461273ad8613a1702c54b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Black Is King Disney Plus\" height=\"1000\" width=\"1333\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">IMDB</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-black-is-king-beyonce-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Black Is King</a>\" is a new feature-length visual album from Beyonc&#233; Knowles-Carter. The film debuted exclusively through <a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/c/196318/564546/9358?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.disneyplus.com%2F&#38;subid2=1596219735372amiknt0td&#38;subId3=xid:fr1596219739205hdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-orig-url=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/c/196318/564546/9358?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.disneyplus.com%2F&#38;subid2=1596219735372amiknt0td\" data-ml-id=\"5\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1596219739205hdf\">Disney Plus</a>&#160;on July 31.</p><p>\"Black Is King\" incorporates the lessons of Disney's \"The Lion King\" into a new visual narrative that features images of the Black diaspora. The movie is directed by Emmanuel Adjei, Blitz Bazawule, and Beyonc&#233;.</p>\n\t'Artemis Fowl' - available now\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ea04ce0a2fd915dd91bdea3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Artemis Fowl Disney\" height=\"807\" width=\"1076\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Disney</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Based on the young adult book by Eoin Colfer, \"Artemis Fowl\" follows a 12-year-old criminal genius named Artemis who embarks on an adventure to find his missing father. While searching for his dad, Artemis encounters a dangerous group of fairies.</p><p>The movie comes from director Kenneth Branagh (\"Thor\", \"Cinderella\"), and stars Ferdia Shaw, Josh Gad, Judi Dench, and Colin Farrell. \"Artemis Fowl\" debuted exclusively through Disney Plus on June 12.&#160;</p>\n\t'Lady and the Tramp' - available now\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ea04c210fc63960647ace98?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lady and the Tramp\" height=\"760\" width=\"1013\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Disney&#43;</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>As recent years have demonstrated, Disney loves a live-action remake.</p><p>This live-action retelling of the 1955 Disney classic \"Lady and the Tramp\" stars Tessa Thompson (\"Westworld,\" \"Thor: Ragnarok\") as the voice of Lady, and Justin Theroux (\"The Leftovers,\" \"Maniac\") as the voice of Tramp.&#160;</p>\n\t'Noelle' - available now\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ea04c34d553f8590f2bb956?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Noelle\" height=\"1038\" width=\"1383\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Disney&#43;</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In the holiday comedy \"Noelle,\" Bill Hader is Nick Kringle, the heir apparent to Santa Claus who runs away from home to escape his fate. Anna Kendrick, who plays his sister Noelle, heads out into the real world to bring him back.</p>\n\t'Togo' - available now\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ea04c40d553f85910321cb8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Togo\" height=\"676\" width=\"901\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Disney&#43;</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"Togo\" is centered around the true story of the 1925 serum run to Nome, or what was known as the Great Race of Mercy, when dog&#160;sled teams braved the elements and harsh terrain to deliver medical serum to stave off an epidemic.</p><p>In the historical adventure drama, William Defoe stars as sled dog owner Leonhard Seppala alongside his rambunctious husky Togo.&#160;</p>\n\t'Timmy Failure: Mistakes Were Made' — available now\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ea04c4af242ab5f42442dc4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Timmy Failure Mistakes Were Made\" height=\"676\" width=\"901\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Disney&#43;</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Based on the novel \"Timmy Failure: Mistakes Were Made\" by New York Times best-selling cartoonist Stephan Pastis, the movie follows the adventures of 11-year-old Timmy Failure (Winslow Fegley), who's under the impression that he's the town's greatest detective.</p>\n\t'Stargirl' - available now\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ea056180fc63967da19d424?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Stargirl Disney\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">IMDB</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>\"</em>America's Got Talent<em>\"&#160;</em>winner, singer, and ukulele player Grace VanderWaal stars as Stargirl Caraway in the teen drama \"Stargirl\" inspired by the book of the same name by Jerry Spinelli.</p><p>The homeschooled Stargirl, a quirky and unconventional character, enrolls in a public high school in Arizona and meets Leo Borlock (Graham Verchere), who falls for her unique charms.&#160;&#160;</p>\n\tDisneynature documentary movies - available now\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ea05392e61f346d803b3f37?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Elephant Disney Plus\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">IMDB</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Disney Plus currently offers access to several exclusive streaming documentaries from the studio's Disneynature division. Here's a rundown of all the Disneynature originals on Disney Plus right now:</p><ul><li>\"Dolphin Reef\"</li><li>\"Elephant\"</li><li>\"Diving with Dolphins\"</li><li>\"In the Footsteps of Elephant\"</li><li>\"Penguins: Life on the Edge\"</li></ul><p>In addition to the platform's original Disneynature movies, Disney Plus also offers a large collection of documentaries from <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/national-geographic-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">National Geographic</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tAll movies available in 2020\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ea04c56f242ab5f64606252?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Phineas and Ferb the Movie  Candace Against the Universe\" height=\"676\" width=\"901\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Disney&#43;</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>\"Phineas and Ferb the Movie: Candace Against the Universe\" (Summer 2020)</strong></p><p>Disney Channel's \"Phineas and Ferb\" may have ended in 2015 after an eight-year run, but its fan base is as strong as ever.</p><p>This is the second feature-length film based on the series. In this new installment of the Phineas and Ferb story, the brothers travel across the galaxy to save their sister Candace who has been abducted by aliens.</p><p><strong>\"Secret Society of Second-Born Royals\" (2020)</strong></p><p>Fresh from her title role on the Disney Channel's \"Andi Mack,\" Payton Elizabeth Lee stars in the contemporary princess tale \"<em>S</em>ecret Society of Second Born Royals.\"</p><p>Lee's character is in the midst of a teenage rebellion against her royal upbringing, where she is second in line to the thrown. Things take a turn when she discovers she has superpowers and becomes part of a secret society of royal heirs.&#160;</p><p><strong>\"Magic Camp\" (2020) </strong></p><p>Adam Devine of \"Pitch Perfect\" fame stars as Andy, a young man who returns to camp as a counselor in hopes of helping his career. The comedy is based on a story by comedian and one-time magician, Steve Martin. The film, originally set for a theatrical release in 2018, will instead premiere on Disney Plus.</p>\n\tAll movies currently without release dates\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ea04c620fc63960647ace9f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Disney&#43;\" height=\"676\" width=\"901\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Disney&#43;</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>\"Safety\" (TBA)</strong></p><p>\"Safety\" is an uplifting drama based on the true story of Ray McElrathbey. The film focuses on a young man who has to raise his 11-year-old brother while juggling his own life and playing football at Clemson University. The movie is being directed by Academy Award nominee Reginald Hudlin (\"Marshall\").<strong>&#160;</strong></p><p><strong>\"Flora &#38; Ulysses\" (TBA)</strong></p><p>Also coming to Disney Plus is a film based on the Newberry Award-winning children's book, \"Flora &#38; Ulysses: The Illuminated Adventures\" by Kate DiCamillo (\"Because of Winn-Dixie,\" \"The Tale of Despereaux\"). The story centers on 10-year-old Flora who saves a squirrel that she names Ulysses and then wreaks havoc on her life. The cast includes Matilda Lawler, Ben Schwartz, Alyson Hannigan, and Kate Micucci.</p><p><strong>\"Godmothered\" (TBA)</strong></p><p>Production is now underway on \"Godmothered\" for Disney Plus. The fantasy holiday film focuses on a fairy godmother-in-training who attempts to help a woman who is in need of some magic in her life. Sharon Maguire (\"Bridget Jones's Diary\") is directing from a script written by Kari Granlund and Melissa Stack. Jillian Bell and Isla Fisher lead the cast, which also includes Jane Curtin and Mary Elizabeth Ellis.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Read everything else you should know about Disney Plus -38-03-443_fe5acb12ced034cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-03-978_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=KtPNSsvo10U:2kvKR6qZLm8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn32@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-38-00-051_4f106cd024f80d11.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=KtPNSsvo10U:2kvKR6qZLm8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn55@2020_4/2020/09/04/16-37-51-070_36ce2b04c6d4c9f8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-085_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=KtPNSsvo10U:2kvKR6qZLm8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn4@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-38-03-085_808d3061fa04a017.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/KtPNSsvo10U":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn40@2020_4/2020/09/04/16-37-57-303_3d9358a90c91515b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599237433623},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"Everything to know about home rental site Vrbo, including how it works and what makes it different from Airbnb","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-vrbo","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f037756f0f419637146d7f4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Family grilling outdoors\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Klaus Vedfelt/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li style=\"text-align: left;\"><a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Vrbo</a> is a vacation rental booking platform where homeowners can list their homes directly without going through a management company.</li><li style=\"text-align: left;\">Only entire homes are listed on <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Vrbo</a>, so you will never have to share with the host or other guests.</li><li style=\"text-align: left;\">Below, we break down everything to know about the home rental site, from pricing and fees to how it differs from competitors such as <a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Airbnb</a>.</li><li style=\"text-align: left;\">Read more: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-airbnbs-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Are vacation rentals safe? We spoke to experts, a company representative, and an Airbnb host to share everything you should know before booking someone's home</a></li></ul><p>Although it's commonly pronounced as \"verb-oh\", <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Vrbo</a> is actually an acronym that stands for \"vacation rentals by owner,\" which says a lot about the rental site's beginnings.</p><p>These days, travelers are pretty accustomed to direct communication with hosts thanks to the rise of online booking platforms like <a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Airbnb</a>, but when Vrbo first launched in 1995, it was a relatively new concept that helped homeowners bypass the cost of a management company. Today, the site boasts over two million private homes in over 190 countries.</p><p>While <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.homeaway.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">HomeAway</a>&#160;and <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Vbro</a> used to be separately branded sites that shared the same listings and were both run by Expedia Group, as of July 2020 <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-vrbo-homeaway\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HomeAway has been entirely folded into Vrbo</a>. Users familiar with HomeAway will find a very similar feel and style on Vrbo and the listings are the same as those previously offered on HomeAway.&#160;</p><p>For those more familiar with <a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F31024214%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1592944059_Wn5dMzPtWKXzifSI%26guests%3D1%26adults%3D1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Airbnb</a>, <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Vrbo</a> has many similarities, but there are a few key differences when it comes down to the booking experience, service fees, and the health and safety precautions being taken to protect travelers from the novel coronavirus.</p><p>The main distinction between the two websites is that homeowners on Vrbo only rent out the whole property, which means you won't find anyone else sharing the space with you. This is unlike Airbnb where you may also book a room in a shared house. Normally, sharing a space with housemates wouldn't be a big issue if the price is right, but in the age of coronavirus, having the place to yourself is a big point for Vrbo.</p><p>This is especially true since <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/which-is-safer-airbnb-hotels-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">experts have said that private home vacation rentals are actually safer than hotels</a> right now since there are far fewer interactions with other people.&#160;</p><h3>Read on to learn how Vrbo works.</h3><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents</bi-shortcode><h2>How booking on Vrbo works</h2><p>The booking experience of <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Vrbo</a> is very similar to what you'd find on Airbnb and other booking platforms. You may filter by the number of bedrooms, property type, house rules, and amenities.</p><p>But, it gets a little finicky when it comes to pricing. Prices won't populate on the page unless you specifically filter by price, and unlike Airbnb, you won't know the total price of your stay until you click through to the main listing page where you can then see a breakdown of the total price and fees.&#160;</p><p>Each property is given an overall rating out of five stars and you'll be able to read reviews at the bottom of the page. If you like a place but aren't ready to commit, you can save it to a \"Trip Board\" and come back to it later.</p><p>Once you book and the homeowner accepts your booking, you'll be able to communicate directly with them about the property's details and check-in process.</p><p>Vrbo also offers a <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/legal/book-with-confidence\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book With Confidence Guarantee,</a> which provides every traveler with payment protection against fraudulent listings and access to a team of re-booking specialists. If the owner cancels at the last minute or you can't get into the house for some reason, the re-booking specialist can help you find somewhere else to stay. Bear in mind that this is not trip insurance and if you decide to cancel your trip on your own accord, you won't be refunded unless you purchase additional trip insurance.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f0376042618b90d282cb1c6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Vrbo in Gatlinburg TN\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Vrbo</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2>How is Vrbo different from Airbnb?</h2><p>In many ways, the experience of sorting through properties on Vrbo is exactly like Airbnb. The main distinction between the two platforms is that Vrbo is strictly for entire home rentals and you will always have the entire home to yourself. Airbnb, on the other hand, tends to emphasize hospitality and market the value of a good host, while Vrbo is strictly about the property.</p><p>In fact, hosts and travelers do not have their own profile pages like they do on Airbnb. This means you can't click through to a reviewer's profile to see whether or not they leave overly negative or positive reviews, nor can you click through to a host's profile to see the other properties they have and read the reviews on those.</p><p>However, Vrbo does have its own version of Airbnb's Superhosts, which they call Premier Partners. These are owners with a low rate of cancellations and an average guest rating above 4.5.</p><p>However, even these qualifications are not quite as strict as Airbnb where Superhosts must average a 4.8 rating to earn Superhost status. Additionally, it's more difficult to compare prices on Vrbo than on Airbnb. For many Vrbo listings, you must click through to the final listing page to see the full breakdown of costs, while Airbnb is more upfront about this information on its listings.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-vrbo-homeaway\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read a full breakdown of the differences between Vrbo and Airbnb here.</a></h3><h2>What is pricing on Vrbo like?</h2><p>The pricing is very reasonable on Vrbo when you compare similar properties in the same area across rental sites.</p><p>In some cities, you can find apartments for as little as $79 per night, like this <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/3633840ha?adultsCount=2&arrival=2020-09-23&departure=2020-09-2520-09-25\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">tiny house in Austin, Texas</a> or you might splurge on a unique property like a <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/246204?adultsCount=2&arrival=2020-09-23&departure=2020-09-2520-09-25\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">home built by a famous architect</a> or a <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/1279904?adultsCount=2&noDates=truetrue\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow nofollow noopener sponsored sponsored\">actual castle</a>.</p><p>Nightly rates will vary depending on where you're searching and the time of year, but prices are rarely lower than $50 per night or higher than $500 per night, unless it is an exceptionally large or unique home, or located in a coveted area in peak season.</p><p>A good way to judge whether or not the rate is competitive for the area is to compare the rate to nearby hotels. For example, in New York City, even shoebox-sized hotel rooms typically start at $100 per night, but on Vrbo, you can <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/search/keywords:new-york-new-york-united-states-of-america?petIncluded=false\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">find some apartments for less than that</a> in all five boroughs.&#160;</p><p>Generally, the nightly cost for standard-quality listings is competitive with other listing sites like Airbnb and often cheaper than hotels. However, keep in mind that like Airbnb, the base listed price on Vbro doesn't include fees. Those fees can add up, so be sure to take that into consideration when browsing listings with a budget in mind.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f0375293ad86167fc78c948?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Luxury Castle in Arlington WA\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Vrbo</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2>How much is the service fee on Vrbo and what does it cover?</h2><p>When you're comparing properties in the list view, you'll only see the cost per night. But when you click through the listing, Vrbo will show you the total cost of your trip based on the dates plugged in and the applicable fee and taxes.</p><p>Beneath the price, you may click \"View details\" to see how this total cost is broken down. Owners can charge varying fees for cleaning, taxes, and even pets, but the service fee will be applied by Vrbo for every booking. The owner has no control over how much the fee is and does not have the power to waive it.</p><p>According to the Vrbo, the service fee goes towards providing \"a safer and more secure booking experience coupled with 24/7 customer support throughout your trip.\" The fee is based on a sliding scale, although it is unclear how exactly they are calculated.</p><p>On some listings, it can be as low as 5% of the total rental amount, and on others, it may be as high as 12%. There's no way to avoid paying the fee on Vrbo, but if you really fall in love with a place, you may be able to find it for a lower price on another booking platform. However, you won't get the benefit of Vrbo's Book With Confidence Guarantee.</p><h2>Is Vrbo safe to book right now?</h2><p>In light of the coronavirus pandemic, Vrbo has refunded traveler fees for bookings made before March 13, 2020, but has not yet released a new cleaning policy to ensure traveler safety going forward. However, they have released <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/discoveryhub/tips-and-resources/improve-performance/clean-disinfect-guidelines\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow nofollow noopener sponsored sponsored\">guidelines</a> for homeowners that encourages:</p><ul><li>Having a proactive plan to manage and minimize risks.</li><li>Implementing enhanced cleaning and disinfecting between stays.</li><li>Providing sufficient hand sanitizer and soap for guests, as well as cleaning and disinfecting products.</li></ul><p>Among listing resources to health authorities and outlining the proper way to clean the property, the information is pretty thorough — but they're just guidelines. While Vrbo encourages its owners to communicate their cleaning measures in the listing itself and with their guests, there's not much they can do to enforce or guarantee that the guidelines will be followed by hosts.</p><p>You might compare this approach to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-new-cleaning-protocol\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Airbnb's Enhanced Cleaning Initiative</a>, which requires hosts to go through a certification program in order to be flagged as an \"enhanced\" property on the site. Additionally, Airbnb is also enforcing a 24-hour buffer period between stays for these properties, or a 72 hour buffer for homes that don't want to comply with such stringent cleaning guidelines, but still want to be promoted as safe options for guests.</p><p>Vrbo has no such badge system in place, so it's up to the travelers to look into each listing's sanitation measures before they book.</p><p>Neither booking platform can guarantee safety, but Vrbo's guidelines do mean that you must have good communication with the homeowner to properly ensure that the property will be clean and safe for your arrival. If the host does not outline their cleaning regimen in the description of the home, try to contact them directly before you pull the trigger and book.</p><p>\"When booking any type of lodging, consider how many people you'll be surrounded by, when was the last time someone stayed in that accommodation, and how is the state or city doing in regards to flattening the curve,\" said Dr. Neil Brown,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.khealth.ai/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"b9fda93f12fd84caca806364ce873cdb\">K Health</a>'s chief diagnosis officer.&#160;</p><h2>What is Vrbo's cancellation policy?</h2><p>Due to the novel coronavirus, future travel plans are up in the air and many travelers are looking for flexibility when it comes to planning vacations.</p><p>While Vrbo did implement a <a href=\"https://help.vrbo.com/articles/What-can-I-do-if-my-reservation-is-affected-by-the-Coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">cancellation policy in response to COVID-19</a>, the policy initially only covered bookings made before March 13, 2020, with stay dates between March 13 and June 30, 2020 that were cancelled because of governmental restrictions to travel or stays in vacation homes for leisure.&#160;</p><p>However, they have not extended the policy beyond the end of June so all new bookings are not covered by the COVID-19 cancellation policy. Instead, you'll need to check individual listings' policies, which include the following options <a href=\"https://help.vrbo.com/articles/What-are-the-cancellation-policy-options\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">according to Vrbo</a>:</p><ul><li><strong>No Refund</strong> - This is the strictest policy and means no refund is offered at all for any reason.</li><li><strong>Strict&#160;</strong>- Bookings must be canceled at least 60 days before the start of the stay to receive a full refund.</li><li><strong>Firm&#160;</strong>- Bookings canceled 60 days or more before the start of the stay will receive a full refund. Bookings canceled between 60 days and 30 days before the start of the stay will receive a 50% refund.</li><li><strong>Moderate</strong> (recommended) - Bookings canceled 30 days or more before the start of the stay receive a full refund. Bookings canceled at least 14 days before receive a 50% refund.</li><li><strong>Relaxed&#160;</strong>- Bookings canceled 14 days or more before the start of the stay will receive a full refund. Bookings canceled at least 7 days before the start of the stay will receive a 50% refund.</li></ul><h3>You can compare this to the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnbs-cancellation-policy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Airbnb cancellation policy here</a>.</h3><h3>Wondering about travel safety right now?</h3><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/is-travel-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Is travel safe? We interviewed experts on risks associated with flying, booking hotels or Airbnbs, renting cars, and more, plus ideas on safe vacations during COVID-19</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-airbnbs-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Are Airbnbs safe? We spoke to experts, a company representative, and an Airbnb host to share everything you should know before booking someone's home</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/which-is-safer-airbnb-hotels-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Which is safer: Airbnb or hotels? Here's what doctors say</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/safe-vacations-during-covid\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">6 safer, expert-backed ways to take a vacation during the pandemic, from road trips to private vacation homes and remote campsites</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/safe-socially-distanced-road-trip\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What to pack and how to prepare before planning a road trip this summer — 9 medical and hospitality experts weigh in with advice and tips</a></li></ul><div
