00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"Dow tumbles 500 points as continued tech sell-off offsets strong labor-market data","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-news-today-index-reaction-august-jobs-report-economy-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5239afe6ff30001d4e70f5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"trader nyse pray\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty Images / Bryan R. Smith</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>US stocks traded mixed Friday after the latest US jobs report showed strong job additions and a better-than-expected unemployment rate in August.</strong></li><li><strong>The Dow Jones Industrial Average and the S&#38;P 500 traded higher after the report was released.</strong></li><li><strong>Tech stocks struggled in comparison following a steep decline Thursday that saw the Nasdaq composite slip roughly 5%.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>US stocks slipped Friday as traders weighed a better-than-expected US jobs report against the lingering effects of Thursday's tech-stock rout.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/august-jobs-report-nonfarm-payrolls-unemployment-rate-us-economy-recovery-2020-9\">US added 1.37 million jobs in August</a>, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, slightly more than economist expectations. The unemployment rate came in at 8.4%, handily besting consensus forecasts and well below the post-pandemic high of 14.7%.</p><p>The strong jobs report did little to quell investor fears stoked after the Nasdaq composite index fell by nearly 5% on Thursday, driven by sharp losses in market mega-caps like Apple, Facebook, and Tesla.</p><p><strong>Here's where US indexes stood at 10:45 a.m. ET on Friday:</strong></p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestedium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">S&#38;P 500</a>:</strong> 3,362.32, down 2.7%</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dow Jones Industrial Average</a>:</strong> 27,764.47, down 1.9% (528 points)</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/nasdaq_composite?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nasdaq composite</a>:</strong> 10,903.36, down 4.8%</li></ul><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-sell-off-trades-to-make-warning-signs-ms-2020-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\">Morgan Stanley's wealth management CIO warns there are 'particularly ominous' signs about the state of the stock market's health — and recommends jumping into these 4 trades during the next major sell-off</a></em></p><p>While the Thursday market sell-off might have put pressure on Washington to ready additional economic stimulus, Friday's jobs report may have slowed that urgency.</p><p>Investors continue to size up how long it will take for the economy to recover from the pandemic and how much higher stocks can go. While tech stocks have led the market higher since the pandemic-induced market correction began in February, valuations are beginning to be questioned.</p><p>Oil prices slid. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?type=wti?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">West Texas Intermediate crude</a> fell as much as 1.3%, to $40.84 a barrel. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Brent crude</a>, the international benchmark, slid 1.2%, to $43.53 a barrel, at intraday lows.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/real-estate-investments-benefits-mobile-homes-over-apartments-ryan-murdock-2020-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Ryan Murdock spent a decade in the semiconductor industry before amassing a real estate portfolio with 50 rental units. Here's why he's scooping up swaths of mobile homes after years of apartment investing.</a></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-news-today-index-reaction-august-jobs-report-economy-2020-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Z6N4tPJQN6Y:XGTQUjkLd6c:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Z6N4tPJQN6Y:XGTQUjkLd6c:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Z6N4tPJQN6Y:XGTQUjkLd6c:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Z6N4tPJQN6Y:XGTQUjkLd6c:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Z6N4tPJQN6Y:XGTQUjkLd6c:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Z6N4tPJQN6Y:XGTQUjkLd6c:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Z6N4tPJQN6Y\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 14:47:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f47e098db1ed000297144c1?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"98beff4aca490a3e97a5e00b0e116d28","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn2@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-37-36-290_6e28120f5009620d.webp","destWidth":1778,"destHeight":1334,"sourceBytes":112934,"destBytes":112934,"author":"mfox@businessinsider.com (Matthew Fox)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f5239afe6ff30001d4e70f5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn51@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-37-39-541_32c84eb9a1d2dcd8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-03-978_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Z6N4tPJQN6Y:XGTQUjkLd6c:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn63@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-38-01-146_ad3a3596d040b821.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Z6N4tPJQN6Y:XGTQUjkLd6c:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn48@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-38-05-974_47fa9f8cb2d62820.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-085_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Z6N4tPJQN6Y:XGTQUjkLd6c:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn11@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-38-01-422_ae7f1774a7986c4c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Z6N4tPJQN6Y":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn31@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-38-06-371_863c03acc055b59e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599237433621},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"Bugatti now sells a kiddie car that costs more than some brand-new BMWs — take a closer look at the Bugatti Baby II","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/bugatti-helped-build-kiddie-car-that-costs-70000-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104ec7ed0ee001e25d3d8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Bugatti teamed up with The Little Car Company to develop a miniature version of its 1920s Type 35 race car.&#160;</li>\n<li>Dubbed the Bugatti Baby II, the car is built to 75% scale and boasts an impressive list of features like LED headlights, hydraulic brakes, and an electric powertrain with regenerative braking.&#160;</li>\n<li>The top-of-the-line model can reach speeds of 42 mph and costs nearly $70,000.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Bugattis might be tempting, but their seven-figure price tags aren't. The good thing is, now's your chance to score one for right around $35,000 — less than the price of the average new car in the US.&#160;</p><p>That may sound like the deal of the century, but, as with all things that sound to good to be true, there is a <em>slight&#160;</em>catch. Although technically a Bugatti, the Bugatti Baby II is, as its name might suggest, a three-quarters-scale replica meant for teens and young adults.&#160;</p><p>Developed jointly by Bugatti and The Little Car Company — which makes, you guessed it, little cars — the Bugatti Baby II isn't some run-of-the-mill pedal car or ride-on toy. It boasts quite the spec list, featuring a limited-slip differential, LED headlights, and hydraulic brakes.&#160;</p><p>In its highest-spec Pur Sang specification, the Baby hits a totally ridiculous top speed of 42 mph. But would you expect anything less than totally ridiculous from Bugatti, the maker of a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bugatti-chiron-pur-sport-swaps-top-speed-for-handling-2020-3\">1,500-horsepower supercar</a>? No, you wouldn't.</p><p>Keep scrolling to take a closer look at the Bugatti Baby II.&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tTo celebrate its 110th anniversary last year, Bugatti teamed up with The Little Car Company to develop a driving, 75% scale car called the Bugatti Baby II.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104ea7ed0ee001e25d3d4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"944\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tNow, Bugatti's sharing all the specs, details, and pricing of the pint-sized ride.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104ec7ed0ee001e25d3d8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAs its name might tell you, this isn't the first time Bugatti has built a miniature car.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104ea7ed0ee001e25d3d5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe original Bugatti Baby was a 50% scale, kiddie version of the Type 35 that Bugatti sold from 1927 to 1936.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f515cf8e6ff30001d4e6fe3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis time around, Bugatti made the Baby a bit larger and brought it into the 21st century.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104e9e6ff30001d4e6d80?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe car comes in three versions, all of which boast rear-wheel drive, a limited-slip differential, hydraulic brakes, and multiple driving modes.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104e9e6ff30001d4e6d81?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhile the base model hits a plenty-respectable top speed of 30 mph, the upper-tier Vitesse and Pur Sang versions can reach a frightening 42 mph.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104ebe6ff30001d4e6d83?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThose models come with a \"speed key\" — much like you might find in a Chiron — which unlocks all of the Baby's 13.4 horsepower.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104ebe6ff30001d4e6d82?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe top-of-the-line Pur Sang model — which Bugatti says is \"targeted at collectors\" — boasts hand-formed aluminum bodywork that requires more than 200 hours to create.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104eb7ed0ee001e25d3d6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe base Baby can travel 15 miles on a charge, while the Vitesse and Pur Sang versions can go twice as far thanks to larger battery packs.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104e87ed0ee001e25d3d3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1014\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Baby's dashboard features working replicas of the original Type 35's instruments, but the oil gauge now displays power and the fuel-pressure gauge shows battery level.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104ece6ff30001d4e6d84?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBugatti and The Little Car Company also carefully recreated the Type 35's handling characteristics using 3D scans of an original car.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f515cf97ed0ee001e25d669?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSome modern touches include LED headlights, a regenerative-braking system, and adjustable dampers so drivers can fine-tune handling.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f515cf67ed0ee001e25d666?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Baby II starts at roughly $35,000 for the base version, while a Pur Sang model will run you close to $70,000.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5104eb7ed0ee001e25d3d7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAlthough all 500 cars sold out within the first three weeks after the project was announced last year, some slots have opened up as clients' circumstances changed \"due to recent global events,\" Bugatti said.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f515cf87ed0ee001e25d668?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bugatti Baby II\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bugatti Baby II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bugatti</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a cf67ed0ee001e25d666?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn24@2020_3/2020/09/04/16-37-54-547_e7ebd54af4c2e749.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f5104eb7ed0ee001e25d3d7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn28@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-38-02-377_bfebf5cc73da1402.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f515cf87ed0ee001e25d668?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn92@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-50-174_095ff6104bfcf880.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-03-978_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=A4-RzKZpR2w:3O7RzYqMOeI:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn36@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-37-56-299_37bf674e87e8316e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=A4-RzKZpR2w:3O7RzYqMOeI:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn96@2020_4/2020/09/04/16-37-36-563_815adf56a7f8795e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-085_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=A4-RzKZpR2w:3O7RzYqMOeI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn28@2020_3/2020/09/04/16-37-56-159_d7be1eaf5dc7ce65.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/A4-RzKZpR2w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn27@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-37-59-209_e18b65109d073c51.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599237433607},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"9 ways to start a conversation with absolutely anyone","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/start-a-conversation-with-anyone-2016-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c548266936c0e19fc2c6fb5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"coworkers job paycheck\" height=\"1257\" width=\"1677\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Use what you know about them.\n<p class=\"copyright\">The Good Brigade/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Many fear public speaking &#8212; and that can extend to one-on-one conversations.</li>\n<li>But skipping the small talk and asking their opinion or recommendation can get the ball rolling.</li>\n<li>Use what you know about them to start a conversation, or ask about their interests.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.</a></li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p><em>LinkedIn Influencer <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=64875646&authType=name&authToken=1h-R&trk=pulse-det-athr_prof-art_hdrprof-art_hdr\" rel=\"nofollow\">Bernard Marr</a> published this post originally on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/article/20141027073838-64875646-how-to-start-a-conversation-with-absolutely-anyone\" rel=\"nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</em></p><p>Did you know that public speaking is often rated the number one thing people are afraid of?</p><p>But while getting up on a stage in front of an audience can definitely be nerve wracking, many people find striking up a conversation one-on-one just as intimidating.</p><p>Maybe it's the CEO of your company, a new colleague, the guy in the mail room, the girl from IT, or a stranger in the street.</p><p>Whomever you want to talk to, there's a way to strike up a conversation. And the best news is that it gets easier with practice.</p><p>Try these conversation starters to talk to absolutely anybody:</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\t1. Skip the small talk\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ba251430ce5f51d008b640e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"coworkers small talk talking\" height=\"1181\" width=\"1574\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Avoid the tired topics.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Rawpixel.com/Shutterstock.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"What's up with this weather?\" and \"How 'bout them [insert local sports team]?\" are as bad as cheesy pick-up lines when it comes to starting a conversation. Avoid tired topics. Every situation is unique, so you should be able to find a unique conversation starter.</p>\n\t2. Ask for their opinion\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d8a3f162e22af07b36dc0d2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"networking event\" height=\"4480\" width=\"5973\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Start with light topics.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Hero Images/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Everyone has one! For someone you don't know well, start with light subjects like the food, the music, the atmosphere, etc. \"Do you like your margaritas with salt or without? Do you watch horror movies? Do you like this song?\" It's probably best to stay away from <em>really</em> sticky subjects like politics unless you already know the person very well.</p>\n\t3. Ask for their advice or recommendations\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc1df507eece51a06253dc7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"friends talking eating\" height=\"1328\" width=\"1771\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bundle it with a compliment.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Taiyou Nomachi/Digital Vision/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>This works very well when commenting on someone's outfit or accessories, as in \"What a great tie! Where did you get it?\" or on the food, as in, \"Everything looks good. What are you having?\"</p>\n\t4. Ask them a question — that's easy to answer\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d02b3f86fc920084158c3c7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"coworkers office\" height=\"1300\" width=\"1733\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Start with an easy question.\n<p class=\"copyright\">fizkes/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>This is great when you know or find out that a person has expertise in a particular field. If you're talking to your company's IT guy, for example, you could ask him whether he's the guy who installs hardware or software. But avoid asking anyone to explain something super complex or involved; if that's where the conversation leads, great, but asking a really complicated question up front can feel demanding.</p>\n\t5. Comment on the environment\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a1353023dbef4cf008b74d0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Thanksgiving dinner friendsgiving food party\" height=\"754\" width=\"1005\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>There&#39;s always something to comment on.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Pressmaster/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>No matter where you are, there are things to comment on: the music, the food, the lights, the guests, and so on. Even if you are stuck in an elevator with someone, you can comment on the music, the speed, the crowdedness, etc.</p>\n\t6. Ask for an update\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5b8707548905f2ff1e8b4ada?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Conversation\" height=\"800\" width=\"1067\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>If you know something about then, ask them about it.\n<p class=\"copyright\">SFIO CRACHO/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If you know someone a little or know them by reputation, ask for an update on something you know they've been doing, for example, \"Oh, Mary mentioned you were taking swing dance classes. How's that going?\"</p>\n\t7. Ask open-ended questions whenever possible\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dfd3ba3855cc2384142b138?format=jpeg\" alt=\"coffee with coworker\" height=\"4480\" width=\"5973\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Always have a follow-up question ready.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Pressmaster/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If your question can be answered with a simple yes or no, don't be surprised if that's what you get. Having follow-up questions ready can also help the conversation flow. If you are asking what kind of food they're having, for example, you might follow up with, \"That sounds good. Do you know what kind of wine would go well with that?\" Almost everything can be followed up with, \"Why?\" (Just don't ask it too many times and end up sounding like a three-year-old!)</p>\n\t8. Ask a hypothetical question\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dfd37a3855cc233a54d65d2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Coworkers talking\" height=\"3933\" width=\"5244\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tie it into something that&#39;s happening in current events.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Fizkes/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>These can be great conversation starters, but try to tie them into something happening at the event or in current events to avoid seeming too random. You might say something like, \"I just saw this movie where all the laws were revoked for one day. What would you do if there were no laws for a day?\"</p>\n\t9. Ask about their kids, pets, or hobbies\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5df2c4f3fd9db26df73a5342?format=jpeg\" alt=\"new parent dad father baby\" height=\"1414\" width=\"1885\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ask them about the things that are important to them.\n<p class=\"copyright\">JGI/Tom Grill/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>People love to talk about the things that are important to them. If you know that your boss loves to sail, asking him about his latest trip is a surefire way to get him talking.</p><h2>More from Bernard Marr:</h2><p style=\"padding-left: 60px;\">&#8226;&#160;<a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/article/20141006071946-64875646-surprising-reasons-your-job-applications-are-not-successful?trk=prof-post\" rel=\"nofollow\">Surprising Reasons Your Job Applications Are Not Successful</a><br />&#8226;&#160;<a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/article/20140923021544-64875646-how-successful-people-deal-with-stress?trk=mp-reader-card\" rel=\"nofollow\">How Successful People Deal With Stress</a><br />&#8226;&#160;<a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/heres-how-tech-proof-your-career-bernard-marr?trk=prof-post\">Here's How to \"Tech-Proof\" Your Career</a></p><p><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">This LinkedIn story was originally published on Business Insider September 3, 2016.</em></p>\n</div><div Switch","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/super-mario-3d-all-stars-available-nintendo-switch-limited-time-2020-9","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f513bb7e6ff30001d4e6ef4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Super Mario 3D All-Stars (Super Mario Galaxy)\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1920\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   \"Super Mario </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\"> \n <li><strong>A trio of classic 3D \"Super Mario\" games are getting remastered for the Nintendo Switch: \"Super Mario 64,\" \"Super Mario Sunshine,\" and \"Super Mario Galaxy.\"</strong></li> \n <li><strong>The three remastered games will be released as \"Super Mario 3D All-Stars\" on September 18. But it will only be available for a limited time, Nintendo said on Thursday.</strong></li> \n <li><strong>In March 2021, the game will be pulled from Nintendo's digital storefront, and physical copies will be limited.</strong></li> \n <li><strong><a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.</a></strong></li> \n</ul>\n<p>The next major \"Super Mario\" game for the Nintendo Switch is a remaster of three classic games, all in a single package named \"Super Mario 3D All-Stars.\"</p>\n<p>With \"Super Mario 3D All-Stars,\" players will get \"Super Mario 64,\" \"Super Mario Sunshine,\" and \"Super Mario Galaxy — all with \"higher resolutions than their original versions\" that Nintendo says were \"optimized for a smooth gameplay experience.\"</p>\n<p>But there's a catch: The collection is only available for a limited time.</p>\n<p>\"'Super Mario 3D All-Stars' will be available as a limited-run retail edition and a digital edition that is available for a limited time until the end of March 2021,\" <a href=\"https://www.nintendo.com/games/detail/super-mario-3d-all-stars-switch/\">the game's product page says</a>. The press release announcing the game was even more specific: The game \"will be available until approximately March 31, 2021,\" it says.</p>\n<p>That includes both physical and digital copies of the game — if you don't buy it through the Nintendo eShop prior to the end of March 2021, it's unclear when you'll be able to buy it again. Nintendo representatives did not respond to a request for comment as of publishing.</p>\n<p>The name of the collection, like the games it collects, is a nostalgic throwback: \"Super Mario All-Stars\" was a Super Nintendo game that collected a variety of NES \"Super Mario Bros.\" games into a combined package with updated visuals.</p>\n<p>Check out the game's debut trailer right here:</p>\n<iframe width=\"800\" height=\"450\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/CPJcaGWoO2c\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe>\n<p><em><strong>Got a tip?</strong>&nbsp;Contact Business Insider senior correspondent Ben Gilbert via email (<a href=\"mailto:bgilbert@businessinsider.com\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">bgilbert@businessinsider.com</a>),</em><em>&nbsp;or Twitter DM (<a href=\"https://twitter.com/RealBenGilbert\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">@realbengilbert</a>). March still feels like yesterday in so many ways.&nbsp;</p>\n <p>This is going to be a pretty big month in the race to make effective coronavirus vaccines and treatments.&nbsp;</p>\n <p>If you can believe it, there are 176 vaccines in the works.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/author/andrew-dunn\">Andrew Dunn</a> rounded up <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-vaccine-timeline-what-to-watch-leading-research-2020-3\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">how the top drugmakers see the race for a cure playing out in 2020 and 2021 and when the first shots might be available.</a></p>\n <p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-vaccine-timeline-what-to-watch-leading-research-2020-3\"><strong>Read the full story, complete with a vaccine tracker graphic here&gt;&gt;</strong></a></p>\n <p>A lot of the vaccines on that list either have important data that might come out this month or are launching critical trials to see how well they work.</p>\n <p>By the end of the month, there's a possibility we'll know if at least one of the vaccines being tested is effective in preventing coronavirus infections.&nbsp;</p>\n <p>On the treatment end of things, there's a chance to get some key data as well, especially for new antibody treatments.&nbsp;</p>\n <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/list-of-catalysts-in-september-for-coronavirus-vaccines-and-treatments-2020-8\">You can read the full story here&gt;&gt;</a></h3>\n <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/list-of-catalysts-in-september-for-coronavirus-vaccines-and-treatments-2020-8\">We could get crucial data on top coronavirus vaccines and treatments this month. Here are the 10 most important events to watch for.</a></h3>\n <p><em>Are you new to Business Insider's paywall? <strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/subscription/prime-discount?r=birefer-lramsey\">Use my link here to get 20% off your subscription. </a>&nbsp;</strong></em></p>\n <hr>\n  <p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dr-ala-stanford-filled-a-gap-in-coronavirus-testing-2020-8\">\n    <figure> \n     <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d48517ffa48002894d31f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dr. Ala Stanford Testing\" height=\"1000\" width=\"1333\" charset=\"\"> \n      <figcaption> \n       <p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Matt Rourke</p> \n      </figcaption> </img>\n    </figure></a></p>\n  <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dr-ala-stanford-filled-a-gap-in-coronavirus-testing-2020-8\">Why Dr. Ala Stanford's plans changed as the coronavirus pandemic hit&nbsp;</a></h3>\n  <p>When the pandemic hit, Dr. Ala Stanford was running a concierge medicine business with clients including Will Smith.&nbsp;</p>\n  <p>But when she saw how the pandemic was disproportionately impacting Black Americans, she set up a program to offer free testing in neighborhoods that were getting hit hard.&nbsp;</p>\n  <p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/author/kimberly-leonard\">Kimberly Leonard</a> has the scoop on how that program unfolded, and what's in store for Stanford's future.&nbsp;</p>\n  <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dr-ala-stanford-filled-a-gap-in-coronavirus-testing-2020-8\">You can read the full story here&gt;&gt;</a></h3>\n  <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dr-ala-stanford-filled-a-gap-in-coronavirus-testing-2020-8\">A doctor who caters to celebrities changed her plans to focus on helping the poorest parts of Philadelphia battle the coronavirus</a></h3>\n  <hr>\n   <p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/telehealth-goodrx-ipo-s1-6-biggest-takeaways-2020-8\">\n     <figure> \n      <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb5c83c42278d0c0a58a2d8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GoodRx.JPG\" height=\"2000\" width=\"2667\" charset=\"\"> \n       <figcaption>\n        GoodRx CEOs Doug Hirsch and Trevor Bezdek \n        <p class=\"copyright\">GoodRx</p> \n       </figcaption> </img>\n     </figure></a></p>\n   <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/telehealth-goodrx-ipo-s1-6-biggest-takeaways-2020-8\">GoodRx is going public</a></h3>\n   <p>It seems every time I close my computer or sign off for the weekend, another healthcare company files to go public!</p>\n   <p>Luckily, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/author/megan-hernbroth\">Megan Hernbroth</a> was on last Friday night, when GoodRx, a company that helps patients get more affordable prescriptions via coupons, dropped its S-1.&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/telehealth-goodrx-ipo-s1-6-biggest-takeaways-2020-8\"></a></p>\n   <p>Inside: she spotted details including that GoodRx is profitable (first time I've seen that in an S-1 since covering the digital health space!) and noted its top investor spots are filled by private equity firms and early employees.&nbsp;</p>\n   <p><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/here-are-biggest-investors-goodrx-ahead-of-its-ipo-2020-8\">Here are the investors and executives that stand to make the most upon GoodRx's public debut.</a></strong></p>\n   <p>Megan dug through the entire 185-page filing to find the most important info related to GoodRx's business.</p>\n   <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/telehealth-goodrx-ipo-s1-6-biggest-takeaways-2020-8\">You can read the full rundown here&gt;&gt;</a></h3>\n   <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/telehealth-goodrx-ipo-s1-6-biggest-takeaways-2020-8\">Digital health startup GoodRx is going public, and we dug through the 185-page filing to find 6 crucial details about the company's plans to provide affordable, direct-to-consumer care</a></h3>\n   <hr>\n    <p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/see-unitedhealth-vc-arm-optum-ventures-biggest-investments-2020-8\">\n      <figure> \n       <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e15dd88b2e66a77fb01fc53?format=jpeg\" alt=\"CMC9165 143 (4)\" height=\"3354\" width=\"4472\" charset=\"\"> \n        <figcaption> \n         <p class=\"copyright\">LetsGetChecked</p> \n        </figcaption> </img>\n      </figure></a></p>\n    <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/see-unitedhealth-vc-arm-optum-ventures-biggest-investments-2020-8\">The biggest bets Optum Ventures has made in its first 3 years</a></h3>\n    <p>Meanwhile, Megan has a rundown on Optum Ventures, the venture arm of healthcare giant UnitedHealth Group.</p>\n    <p>You've probably heard of UnitedHealth — it also operates the largest health insurer in the US, a massive pharmacy-benefits business, and more.</p>\n    <p>The investments give us a sense of UnitedHealth's views on the future of healthcare, and include everything from testing business LetsGetChecked to pharmacy startup Truepill.&nbsp;</p>\n    <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/see-unitedhealth-vc-arm-optum-ventures-biggest-investments-2020-8\">You can read the full list here&gt;&gt;</a></h3>\n    <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/see-unitedhealth-vc-arm-optum-ventures-biggest-investments-2020-8\">The biggest US health insurer has a $600 million VC arm that places bets on the future of healthcare. Here are Optum Ventures' 12 biggest investments.</a></h3>\n    <hr>\n     <p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cvs-told-staff-to-hide-worker-covid-19-cases-from-patients-2020-8\">\n       <figure> \n        <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d023160bf1f00280796f7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Pills photo stylized\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\"> \n         <figcaption> \n          <p class=\"copyright\">Irene Jiang/Business Insider</p> \n         </figcaption> </img>\n       </figure></a></p>\n     <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cvs-told-staff-to-hide-worker-covid-19-cases-from-patients-2020-8\">What happens when the staffer filling your prescription tests positive for COVID-19</a></h3>\n     <p>Finally, my colleague <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/author/irene-jiang\">Irene Jiang</a> on the retail team here at Business Insider had an important story on how CVS is handling it when pharmacy staffers test positive for COVID-19.&nbsp;</p>\n     <p>A leaked email showed that a CVS district leader told pharmacy staff not to tell patients if a staffer who had tested positive for COVID-19 had filled their prescription.&nbsp;</p>\n     <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cvs-told-staff-to-hide-worker-covid-19-cases-from-patients-2020-8\">You can read the full story here&gt;&gt; </a></h3>\n     <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cvs-told-staff-to-hide-worker-covid-19-cases-from-patients-2020-8\">Leaked email reveals CVS district leader instructed pharmacy staff not to tell patients their medications were filled by someone who tested positive for COVID-19</a></h3>\n     <hr>\n      <p>Hope you all have a great holiday weekend!</p>\n      <p>Be sure to reach me at <a href=\"mailto:lramsey@businessinsider.com\">lramsey@businessinsider.com</a> with words of encouragement for the fall sprint (and tips, of course). (Lydia Ramsey Pflanzer)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5c13cbd72a5b7412eb4e0b07?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn44@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-37-56-536_c2b8db293efdf958.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f2fa91140c1f33854073866?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn12@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-38-01-021_fbf921728d9b8d3e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4d48517ffa48002894d31f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-02-290_a4333e4e21c0d5a2.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb5c83c42278d0c0a58a2d8?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn56@2020_3/2020/09/04/16-38-02-007_f14efe00928e894a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e15dd88b2e66a77fb01fc53?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn44@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-38-05-964_3bba1c705c3fd390.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4d023160bf1f00280796f7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn13@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-38-05-582_ee117d7fc0f3405a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-03-978_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=804_sJmmXkk:pgH8yjHk6OY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn60@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-58-273_e5bf99c37734cc4d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=804_sJmmXkk:pgH8yjHk6OY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn95@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-37-52-070_66b2de708b589fe7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-085_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=804_sJmmXkk:pgH8yjHk6OY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn63@2020_5/2020/09/04/16-38-02-720_cf48371281db4c22.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/804_sJmmXkk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn84@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-49-745_45f4086cc6c8f1f3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599237433618},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"Why you should request your November mail ballot as soon as possible, and when you can expect to receive it","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/when-will-i-get-november-absentee-mail-ballot-state-guide-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f315a4fa6f0e16f3a42bdbd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Washington ballots \" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A worker processes mailed-in ballots from Tuesday&#39;s primary election, Wednesday, Aug. 5, 2020, at the King County Elections headquarters in Renton, Wash., south of Seattle.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ted Warren/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>This year, a record number of American voters are expected to cast their ballots from home for the November 3 election because of the COVID-19 pandemic.&#160;</li><li>North Carolina will be the first state to start sending out ballots to voters on September 4, 2020, 60 days before the election.</li><li>Most other states begin sending out ballots three to six weeks out.&#160;</li><li>There's no guarantee that you'll get your ballot or that it'll be returned back to your election office by any specific date, or within a specific time.&#160;</li><li><strong>Voters can already request their November mail ballots in every state except Mississippi. </strong></li><li><strong>Experts and officials are encouraging voters to apply for their ballots as soon as possible to ensure every vote is counted.</strong></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>More Americans than ever are expected to vote from home instead of going to the polls in person this November, <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/politics/vote-by-mail-states/?no_nav=true&p9w22b2p=b2p22p9w00098&tid=a_classic-iphonec-iphone\">with a Washington Post analysis</a> finding that over 190 million voters will either receive ballots in the mail or be able to vote by mail without an excuse beyond fear of contracting COVID-19.&#160;</p><p>If you're a registered voter in <strong>California, Colorado, Hawaii, Nevada, New Jersey, Oregon, Utah, Vermont, Washington, the District of Columbia, </strong>or some counties in <strong>Montana </strong>you'll most likely be receiving a ballot in the mail from your local election officials and won't need to take further action.&#160;</p><p>Some more states <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/politics/vote-by-mail-states/?no_nav=true&p9w22b2p=b2p22p9w00098&tid=a_classic-iphonec-iphone\">will be sending all or most voters mail ballot applications</a>, which you can easily fill out and return to get your ballot.&#160;</p><p>In addition to the states sending voters a mail ballot, <strong>voters can already request their November mail ballots in every US state. </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/deadlines-for-absentee-and-mail-ballot-in-every-state-2020-7\">You can find specific deadlines to request and return your mail ballot here.&#160;</a></p><p>Here's when states starting sending out November general election ballots to all voters or those who have affirmatively requested them, according to <a href=\"https://www.ncsl.org/research/elections-and-campaigns/vopp-table-7-when-states-mail-out-absentee-ballots.aspx\">the National Council of State Legislatures.</a></p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe title=\"When states will begin sending out 2020 ballots\" aria-label=\"chart\" id=\"datawrapper-chart-JyVY0\" src=\"https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/JyVY0/1/\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"width: 0; min-width: 100% ; border: none;\" height=\"727\"></iframe><script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(){\"use strict\";window.addEventListener(\"message\",(function(a){if(void 0!==a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"])for(var e in a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"]){var t=document.getElementById(\"datawrapper-chart-\"+e)||document.querySelector(\"iframe[src*='\"+e+\"']\");t&&(t.style.height=a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"][e]+\"px\")}}))}();</script></div><p>While the timing varies between states and counties, in general, <strong>the earlier you request your ballot, the sooner you'll get it.&#160;</strong></p><p>And importantly, the US Postal Service has told election officials they cannot guarantee that election mail <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/voters-should-request-mail-ballots-15-days-before-election-usps-2020-7\">will be delivered inbound to voters or outbound back to election offices by any specific date</a>. The Postal Service recommends that voters plan for their ballot <strong><a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/covid-19-vote-by-mail-ballot-counted-election/\">to take at least a 14-day round trip</a></strong> to get to them and back, and advises voters sending their ballots back through the mail do so <strong>at least seven days</strong> before the election, but ideally sooner.&#160;</p><p><strong>North Carolina</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/2020-election-voting-begins-september-4-north-carolina-mails-ballots-2020-9\">became the first state to start sending out ballots to voters on September 4, 2020,</a>60 days before the election. Most states begin sending out ballots three-to-six weeks out.&#160;</p><p>The DC Board of Elections told Insider they haven't nailed down a specific date for when they plan to start sending ballots, but hope to do so starting in mid-October.&#160;</p><p>It's also important to note that because election administration in the United States is decentralized down to the county level, the timeline for when states start sending out ballots <strong>can vary somewhat from county to county</strong> within states and may be changed due to the pandemic. When in doubt, <a href=\"https://www.nass.org/can-i-vote\">check with your state and local election officials</a> for more specific information.&#160;</p><p>Above all, experts and election officials <strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/easy-things-you-can-do-to-make-november-election-a-success-2020-7\">are urging Americans to request and return their mail ballots as soon as possible</a></strong> and not wait until right before the election, where local election offices are likely to be slammed with an influx of last-minute ballot requests.&#160;</p><p>By now, Americans are all-too-familiar with the concept of flattening the curve of the COVID-19 pandemic by keeping the rate of infections down to avoid overwhelming the capacity while extending the outbreak.</p><p>Experts have applied the same analogy to mail voting, telling Insider that in order to avoid overwhelming the capacity of their local elections offices, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/alysoun/status/1285901577975468033\">voters must flatten the curve of mail ballot requests</a> by requesting theirs as soon as possible, ideally months or weeks in advance, and return their ballot as soon as possible.&#160;</p><p>The sooner you request your ballot, the sooner you'll receive it, which means you'll be able to send it back early and have the peace of mind knowing that your ballot arrived at your election office in plenty of time. If you send your ballot back at the last minute,<strong> <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/07/13/889751095/signed-sealed-undelivered-thousands-of-mail-in-ballots-rejected-for-tardiness\">you leave your vote up to chance.&#160;</a></strong></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/when-will-i-get-november-absentee-mail-ballot-state-guide-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a (Shayanne Gal,Grace Panetta)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f315a4fa6f0e16f3a42bdbd?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn47@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-279_d7f72b3bcd164adc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-03-978_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4nhgxcyquPc:uH3dbbt_WtQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn68@2020_4/2020/09/04/16-38-01-071_9863c91276c47791.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4nhgxcyquPc:uH3dbbt_WtQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn67@2020_2/2020/09/04/16-38-04-477_c424368077436c53.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-37-59-085_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4nhgxcyquPc:uH3dbbt_WtQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn16@2020_6/2020/09/04/16-38-01-532_f41becbb5008a16e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/4nhgxcyquPc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn100@2020_1/2020/09/04/16-38-01-163_57c17f68f46d2f05.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599237433629},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"Hyundai's most popular SUV is getting a major style overhaul, including a 'jewel-like' front grille","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/2021-hyundai-tucson-teaser-new-styling-and-2-wheelbases-available-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f51373fe6ff30001d4e6ecb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Hyundai Tucson_1\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The all-new Hyundai Tucson.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hyundai</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Hyundai is about to launch the all-new, fourth-generation version of the Tucson.&#160;</li>\n<li>It&#8217;ll have a &#8220;jewel-like&#8221; front grille and will be available in both short- and long-wheelbase setups to suit different markets.&#160;</li>\n<li>The official debut will take place on September 15.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The current version of Hyundai's most popular SUV, the Tucson, is a fine car. But after about five years on the market, it's getting a little old.&#160;</p><p>Thus, the fourth-generation Tucson is coming, and this is your first peek at it.&#160;</p><p>On Wednesday, Hyundai published three teaser photos of the new car. They're shadowy images, which Business Insider brightened up for your viewing pleasure, and show what appears to be a completely redesigned front and rear. It's a complete departure from the styling of the current car, which can be seen below.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f514732e6ff30001d4e6f54?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Hyundai Tucson\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2021 Hyundai Tucson.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hyundai</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>A style overhaul on the Tucson is a big deal for Hyundai. It was the automaker's top-selling SUV in 2019, with more than 137,000 models sold. The only vehicle in Hyundai's lineup that beat the Tucson was the smaller Elantra, which logged more than 175,000 sales last year.</p><p>The Tucson's new front fascia wears what <a href=\"https://www.hyundainews.com/en-us/releases/3121\">Hyundai calls</a> \"Parametric Hidden Lights\" that are composed of daytime running lights integrated into the \"jewel-like\" grille. Hyundai said they are only revealed when turned on.&#160;</p><p>Unsurprisingly, the new Tucson will be bigger and wider than the outgoing model, likely to please a market that constantly craves bigger and wider cars. Inside, the automaker likens the new Tucson to the feeling of a \"modern boutique hotel.\" Judging from the photo, we can expect an integrated touchscreen as the center display console, as well as another screen to display driver information.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5137407ed0ee001e25d53d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Hyundai Tucson_3\" height=\"1453\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The all-new Hyundai Tucson.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hyundai</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Hyundai also said the new Tucson will be the first compact SUV in its class to offer two different wheelbases, depending on which market it needs to satisfy. There will be short- and long-wheelbase versions of the Tucson — not unlike how there's a regular Audi A8 sedan and also an A8 L extended wheelbase sedan for extra cabin room.</p><p>Hyundai didn't offer any stats, pricing, or availability information at this time, but notes that the new Tucson's official press reveal will take place on September 15.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f513740e6ff30001d4e6ecc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2021 Hyundai Tucson_2\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The all-new Hyundai Tucson.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hyundai</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 00:37:13","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 00:37:13","title":"The top 10 entry-level jobs hiring during the coronavirus pandemic","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/entry-level-jobs-for-recent-college-graduates-during-covid-19-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2992385af6cc40aa486804?format=jpeg\" alt=\"zoom tutor\" height=\"3456\" width=\"4608\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by Blake Nissen for The Boston Globe via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://fitsmallbusiness.com/\">Fit Small Business</a>, a research firm catered to small business owners, has <a href=\"https://fitsmallbusiness.com/entry-level-jobs-for-college-grads/\">found</a> the top 10 jobs hiring for entry-level gigs amid the coronavirus pandemic.&#160;</li>\n<li>The jobs pay $29,000 a year to $55,000 a year, and hire entry-level workers with a high school diploma, an associate's degree, or a bachelor's degree.&#160;</li>\n<li>Here are the 10 jobs hiring the most for entry-level workers right now.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p>Americans who entered the job market this summer had to navigate <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-jobless-claims-unemployment-insurance-labor-market-filings-recession-coronavirus-2020-7\">record joblessness</a> caused by the coronavirus pandemic — but data suggests hiring might be picking back up in some industries.&#160;</p><p>In late August, job openings on Indeed were down <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/job-openings-are-down-20-percent-high-wage-growth-lags-2020-9\">20% year-over-year</a>, an improvement from May, when job postings were down 39.3% relative to one year prior.&#160;</p><p>To help recent grads, <a href=\"https://fitsmallbusiness.com/\">Fit Small Business</a>, a research firm catered to small business owners, <a href=\"https://fitsmallbusiness.com/entry-level-jobs-for-college-grads/\">found</a> the top 10 jobs hiring for entry-level gigs.</p><p>The jobs highlighted below are entry-level positions for adults with a four-year degree, a two-year degree, or a high school diploma. The jobs cater to demand increased by the coronavirus pandemic</p><p>To find the top entry-level jobs during the pandemic, Fit Small Business used data from major online job sites including Glassdoor, LinkedIn, PayScale and Indeed, plus qualitative data analysis from the Bureau Of Labor Statistics, Statista, and Brookings Institution. Fit Small Business analyzed job posting trends in the month of May, and said that while they don't have more recent data, the findings can still apply to the current market.</p><p>Here are the top 10 jobs for entry-level workers looking for gigs right now:</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\t10. Store associates earn an average starting salary of $29,000 per year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2992c83f7370035b3f4945?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Kroger Associate Image 04\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1779\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kroger</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong><a href=\"https://www.bls.gov/ooh/sales/retail-sales-workers.htm\">Job requirements:</a></strong> No formal education credential&#160;</p><p><em><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/search/?currentJobId=1949518083&#38;geoId=103644278&#38;keywords=Store%20associates&#38;location=United%20States\">Find jobs on LinkedIn</a></em></p>\n\t9. Customer service representatives earn an average starting salary of $32,000 per year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f29929a5fa9a442b01f8412?format=jpeg\" alt=\"customer service representative\" height=\"3478\" width=\"4637\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">DigitalVision/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong><a href=\"https://www.bls.gov/ooh/office-and-administrative-support/customer-service-representatives.htm\">Job requirements:</a></strong> High school diploma or equivalent&#160;</p><p><em><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/search/?currentJobId=1960079954&#38;geoId=103644278&#38;keywords=customer%20service%20representative&#38;location=United%20States\">Find jobs on LinkedIn</a></em></p>\n\t8. Delivery drivers earn an average starting salary of $35,000 per year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f298b201918246de50aa1e4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amazon delivery driver\" height=\"2400\" width=\"3200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.bls.gov/ooh/transportation-and-material-moving/delivery-truck-drivers-and-driver-sales-workers.htm\">Job requirements:</a> High school diploma</p><p><em><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/search/?currentJobId=1879754596&#38;geoId=103644278&#38;keywords=delivery%20driver&#38;location=United%20States\">Find jobs on LinkedIn</a></em></p>\n\t7. Data specialists earn an average starting salary of $36,000 per year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f298ab224381746e069d446?format=jpeg\" alt=\"data analyst analyzing charts\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sarinya Pinngam / EyeEm/ Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong><a href=\"https://www.bls.gov/ooh/computer-and-information-technology/database-administrators.htm\">Job requirements:</a></strong> Bachelor's degree</p><p><em><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/search/?currentJobId=1939519298&#38;geoId=103644278&#38;keywords=Data%20specialist&#38;location=United%20States\">Find jobs on LinkedIn</a></em></p>\n\t6. Underwriting assistants earn an average starting salary of $44,000 per year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f298a6c58c24d484c00d3d3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"insurance underwriter\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Compassionate Eye Foundation/Natasha Alipour Faridani/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong><a href=\"https://www.bls.gov/ooh/business-and-financial/insurance-underwriters.htm\">Job requirements:</a></strong> Bachelor's degree</p><p><em><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/search/?currentJobId=1756493063&#38;geoId=103644278&#38;keywords=Underwriting%20assistant&#38;location=United%20States\">Find jobs on LinkedIn</a></em></p>\n\t5. Warehouse managers earn an average starting salary of $45,000 per year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f29898ede1e965075695eeb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amazon warehouse\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mark Lennihan/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong><a href=\"https://www.bls.gov/ooh/business-and-financial/logisticians.htm\">Job requirements:</a></strong> Bachelor's degree</p><p><em><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/search/?currentJobId=1939587368&#38;keywords=Warehouse%20manager\">Find jobs on LinkedIn</a></em></p>\n\t4. Tutors earn an average starting salary of $30,000 to 50,000 per year, depending on subject.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f29891b2618b97537370514?format=jpeg\" alt=\"kid child student on computer online learning education tutor\" height=\"4016\" width=\"5355\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kseniya Ovchinnikova/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong><a href=\"https://www.bls.gov/ooh/education-training-and-library/teacher-assistants.htm\">Job requirements:</a></strong> Some college</p><p><em><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/search/?currentJobId=1975475381&#38;geoId=103644278&#38;keywords=tutor&#38;location=United%20States\">Find jobs on LinkedIn</a></em></p>\n\t3. Web developers earn an average starting salary of $57,000 per year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ef3b3d33f737027274afad6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"web developer\" height=\"3064\" width=\"4085\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong><a href=\"https://www.bls.gov/ooh/computer-and-information-technology/web-developers.htm\">Job requirements:</a></strong> Associate's degree</p><p><em><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/search/?currentJobId=1850226533&#38;geoId=103644278&#38;keywords=web%20developer&#38;location=United%20States\">Find jobs on LinkedIn</a></em></p>\n\t2. Health informatics specialists earn an average starting salary of $62,000 per year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2987f128ea71472c6d7b01?format=jpeg\" alt=\"health information specialist\" height=\"3840\" width=\"5120\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://healthinformatics.uic.edu/blog/health-information-specialist-career-path-overview/#:~:text=Regular%20duties%20include%20reviewing%20records,analysis%2C%20tracking%20medical%20outcomes%20to\"><strong>Job requirements:</strong></a> At least an associate's degree and certification in health information technology or related programs</p><p><em><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/search/?currentJobId=1929334898&#38;geoId=103644278&#38;keywords=Health%20informatics%20specialist&#38;location=United%20States\">Find jobs on LinkedIn</a></em></p>\n\t1. Contact tracers earn an average starting salary of $55,000 per year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f298204de1e964f3e442899?format=jpeg\" alt=\"contact tracing contact tracer coronavirus covid-19\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A smartphone belonging to Drew Grande, 40, of Cranston, R.I., shows notes he made for contact tracing Wednesday, April 15, 2020. src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52156d7ed0ee001e25d746?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Warren Buffett\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.gettyimages.com/photos/warren-buffett?agreementtypes=ed&#38;excludenudity=true&#38;family=editorial&#38;phrase=warren%20buffett&#38;sort=mostpopular\" target=\"_blank\">Chip Somodevilla / Getty</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><ul><li><strong>Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway saw the value of its Apple stock tumble as much as $19 billion in two days as the tech sell-off continued.</strong></li><li><strong>Apple's stock price dropped 8% on Thursday and as much as 7% on Friday, slashing the value of Berkshire's roughly 981 million shares in the tech titan to below $110 billion.</strong></li><li><strong>Berkshire has still more than tripled the value of its Apple investment, as it spent about $35 billion to build the 5.7% stake.</strong></li><li><strong>Its Apple stake is still worth more than the market capitalization of Citigroup or Starbucks.</strong></li><li><strong><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></strong><hr></li></ul><p>Warren Buffett's <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/brk-b-stock\">Berkshire Hathaway</a> saw more than $19 billion wiped off the value of its <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/aapl-stock\">Apple</a> stock during the tech rout on <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-news-today-indexes-plunge-tech-plunge-jobless-claims-2020-9-1029561733\">Thursday</a> and Friday.</p><p>The famed investor's conglomerate owns close to 981 million Apple shares following the recent <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/apple-stock-split-price-what-that-means-how-many-shares-2020-7-1029455711?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\">four-for-one stock split</a>, giving it a 5.7% stake in the iPhone maker.</p><p>Apple's stock price tumbled 8% on Thursday and as much as 7% on Friday. The decline cut the value of Berkshire's stake to less than $110 billion at one point — $26 billion below its $135 billion peak on Wednesday, when Apple shares hit a record high.</p><p><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">Read More:</em></strong><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">&#160;</em><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-invest-in-real-estate-after-coronavirus-tips-ubs-2020-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-invest-in-real-estate-after-coronavirus-tips-ubs-2020-9\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">A UBS real estate-investing chief told us 5 ways investors can profit from the pandemic's transformation of how Americans live and work — including the housing markets poised to boom</a></em></p><p>However, Apple stock is still up more than 50% this year. Its outperformance reflects unprecedented efforts by the US government and Federal Reserve to keep markets afloat, the boom in day traders with an insatiable appetite for tech stocks, and robust demand for Apple's products and services as consumers seek to stay informed, entertained, and productive during the pandemic.</p><p>Berkshire remains heavily in the green on Apple, the biggest holding in its stock portfolio. It spent about $35 billion to build the position between 2016 and 2018, meaning it has still more than tripled the value of its investment. However, its current $74 billion gain is well below the $100 billion level it briefly hit on Wednesday.</p><p>Still, Berkshire's $109 billion in Apple stock is worth roughly as much as the entire market capitalization of IBM and more than Citigroup ($108 billion) or Starbucks ($101 billion). It's also more valuable than Buffett's personal fortune of about $83 billion, <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/\">according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index</a>.</p><p><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">Read More:&#160;</em></strong><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-stock-sale-why-to-buy-retail-investors-tasha-keeney-2020-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-stock-sale-why-to-buy-retail-investors-tasha-keeney-2020-9\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">One of Tesla's biggest bulls on Wall Street breaks down how the company's $5 billion stock sale could benefit retail investors — and explains why the electric-car giant would still be cheap at $1,400 per share in 2024</a></em></p><p>Moreover, Berkshire's Apple stake represents more than 20% of Berkshire's $516 billion market capitalization. That's striking because Berkshire owns scores of companies including Geico and See's Candies, it boasted $390 billion in net assets at the last count, and Apple is just one of the more than 40 holdings in its equity portfolio.</p><p><strong>Here's Apple's stock chart for the year so far:</strong></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f525c3ce6ff30001d4e71e2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Apple chart Sep 2020\" height=\"705\" width=\"913\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Markets Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><div class=\"read-original\">Read the
